job_title: CRM Marketing Operations Manager - Salesforce Marketing Cloud
job_desc: CRM Marketing Operations Manager – Salesforce Marketing Cloud  Location: Hybrid working - in office 10 days in every month. Central London offices, Zone 1.  Salary: £60,000 - £68,000 plus 10% bonus, pension, healthcare, life assurance, etc.  You’re going to be given control of a sizable part of this company’s product estate, and responsibility to oversee the development and continuous evolution of their email marketing and CRM capability which supports cross, upsell, re-engagement and retention  marketing efforts for the business.  It’s a multi-product category area with a customer base in the tens of millions, and as the manager, you will be charged with ensuring what you and your team are delivering evolves to become ‘best in class’, supported by some of the best martech tools available,  and with a brilliant team alongside you within CRM strategy, planning, data planning and data science.  ABOUT THE ROLE  This is a technical CRM Ops role, but not a developer role. Overseeing a team of CRM Specialists who are responsible for the build, test and optimisation of CRM lifecycle customer journeys, principally over email. But also extend to onsite and app experiences  too.  What sets the manager role apart from the team is the ability to step back and have a more holistic, bigger picture, strategic world view of CRM campaigns, and the challenges which might exist when considering how to create scalable, yet highly personalised  journeys for customers for a company that has tens of millions of customers and a highly complex product set.  As the manager, you’ll be adept at removing such complexities for your team, giving them a clear way forward, yet also maintaining that high degree of sophistication in personalisation and dynamic content within the campaigns and journeys they’re creating.  The main platform your team will be working with will be Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and specifically the Journey Builder tool. Coupled with Taxi for Email.  Building emails within Salesforce and using AMPScript for dynamic content. Working through the logic behind customer journeys and the assets needed to support and automate them.  Working with the content and campaign teams to ensuring quality control before campaigns go live, as well as continuously refine and optimise campaigns through A/B testing.  A good knowledge of HTML would be useful, but this isn’t the kind of role where you’ll be coding. It’s more just in case the team run into any campaign code issues and you’re able to drop into provide support.  A lot of what you and your team will be aligned to are considered ‘growth markets’ with significant headroom for value enhancement, particularly through cross and upsell within the existing customer base.  About the company  They’re a consumer champion brand and a digital economy darling. Mission driven, highly creative and commercially sharp. The last couple of years have seen the business realise significant commercial success, culminating in consistent outperformance of commercial  goals and objectives which have put the company in a very strong position going forwards.  Their offices are located in Central London, within easy reach of a number of tube stations, not far from Shoreditch and Liverpool Street. But their working set up is hybrid, typically 2 days in office a week. The option is there to do more if you like,  and their office is very much a destination worth going to. Modern, plush, creative, inspiring. In a great part of town and you’ll find you’ll be surrounded by like-minded people who enjoy spending time with each other (not just there because a of company  policy).  Experience Needed  Must have a solid understanding of SFMC and particularly Journey Builder Previous line management experience of CRM / marketing automation specialists You have experience of working with dynamic content and personalisation, with good knowledge of AMPScript Ability to look at the bigger picture of highly complex, personalised campaigns with lots of variables and provide good strategic direction to your team in how to simplify the build. Yet maintain the sophistication and personalisation capabilities. Pro-active mentality and nature, not wait for the work to come to you. But always looking for ways to improve a CRM programme and have you and your team have a positive impact to a business Good understanding of how to build customer journeys and apply an overlay of lifecycle marketing to these Good knowledge of A/B testing and email journey enhancement/optimisation. With the ability to utilise the data from these to improve CRM strategies A real desire and mindset of ‘how can I make this better’ versus just churning out campaigns to meet deadlines – and not afraid to tear things up and start again if that’s what it takes to improve things. Appetite for continued learning and development. Always open to picking up a new skill or technology Want to Apply? Here’s how: You can share your Linkedin profile or email me a CV – it doesn’t have to be up to date, we can work on that once you decide you want to take this forward.  Or, for a chat and more information please contact me on:  Colin DoreeHead of Recruitment, Data & CRMBlue Pelican

job_title: Head of Brand and Consumer Insights
job_desc: We are partnering with a leading provider of security services across europe. The business are looking to hire a Head of Brand and Consumer Insights into their team in London.  Client Details The business are a high growth, private equity backed security services company who are looking to hire a Head of Brand and Consumer Insights into their growing marketing team in London. This is a new role which will be focused on leading on customer insights  and brand building in order to increase their presence and sales across the UK.  Description Key responsibilities of the Head of Brand and Consumer Insights: Strategic Leadership:  Determine the core drivers we must work on to build the category of monitored, intervention-based alarm services and position the brand as market leader in the category.Drive visibility and impact of Consumer Insights, Bring the Voice of the Consumer in business decisions across the UK&IE, focused on marketing & innovation initiatives, while sharing best practices with the wider organisation.Deliver Consumer Insights with a data-driven attitude but based on high empathy for people and the human behaviours behind the numbers.Develop and implement brand communication strategies that align with the company's overall marketing and business objectives.Help define current and long-term goals for the Brand, Consumer Insights, and Communications teams.Work with the Marketing Director and Managing Directors to define the long-term strategy for Marketing Consumer Insights within the UK&IE to keep driving its relevancy to support marketing & innovation, and its ability to impact the business (considering  scope, responsibilities, team structure, etc)Messaging and Content Creation: Develop simple to understand messages that build on the core drivers identified.Own end-to-end Insights delivery from all sources of data. This will include identifying sources of data available, finding ways to gather unavailable data, exploiting & analysing the data, extracting insights and connecting them to business applications,  as well as crafting the messaging and content strategy to exploit them.Collaborate with the Group Brand team to ensure alignment on wider company goals and strategy while maintaining the focus on delivering local success stories that can be shared and replicated in other markets.Ensure consistency in brand messaging across all platforms and communications, and that all content adheres to brand guidelines and voice.Create compelling and coherent brand messages that resonate with target audiences.Oversee the development of content, including press releases, website copy, social media posts, and marketing materials.Stakeholder Engagement: Ensure insights are delivered in a simple, inspiring, and convincing way.Ensure internal stakeholders are aligned with the brand's communication strategies and messaging.Develop internal communication programs to keep employees informed and engaged.Promote a consistent internal brand culture.Media Relations and Public Relations: Build and maintain relationships with media outlets, journalists, and influencers.Develop and execute public relations campaigns to enhance brand visibility and reputation.Handle crisis communication and manage the company's response to negative publicity.Take control of organic social media - oversee the company's presence, strategise content and engagement campaigns, and monitor the brand.Budget & Team Management: Manage budget for brand communications campaigns, allocating resources efficiently to maximise impact and ROI.Recruit, hire, and train the Brand, Consumer Insights, and Communications teams, while fostering collaboration between these teams and other relevant departments.Profile The successful candidate: 5-7 years proven experience in branding, with a big plus for a proven track record in category shaping roles (opposed to market share gain focussed roles)Bachelor's degree or equivalent in a Mathematics or Science field. Statistics, Economics, Engineering or Business Management fields preferred. Master's degree is a plus.Highly proficient in Excel and PowerPoint. Strong knowledge on advanced Market Research & Data Analysis techniques.Reliable, autonomous, organised and able to prioritize multiple tasks.Highly analytical to distil data into information and recommendations.Impeccable business communication & presentation skills.Head of Consumer Insights & Branding Skills and Qualifications 5 years working in a Market Research, Consulting, Strategy, or Data Analytics role.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills and experience successfully implementing analytical solutions with real-world business impact.Excellent written and verbal presentation skills with an ability to influence up to Director/Managing Director levelStrong empathy and ability to connect to the reality of people / emotions / actions that are behind consumer data (previous experience connected to Consumer Insights a plus)Experience in treating high quantities sets of data to extract leanings & insightsExperience in data science projects such as regression models, decision trees, clusterisation, conjoint analyses, etc.Experience in startups or fast paced environments. Versatility and agility with ability to be both technical and have a strategical business mindsetDemonstrate initiative and ownership of tasks and projects.Ability to prioritize, coordinate and complete tasks to meet deadlines.Ability to work effectively both independently and in team environments.Will have worked in an FMCG or consumer services industry Job Offer Competitive

Introduction to the role What is the difference between war and armed conflict? Did an error cause a system failure, or was it a cyber-attack? How, when and where should an insured asset be valued? The answers to these questions could be critical in determining whether losses arising  from an event are insured or not; it will depend on the language used in insurance policies. The Lloyd's Market Association (LMA) has a wordings vacancy within its Underwriting Team, reporting to the Head of Technical Underwriting. The LMA supports the Lloyd's market by producing over 100 model wordings per year, across a huge range of subject areas,  including cyber, terrorism & political violence, property, energy, casualty and specialty products. Working with underwriters, lawyers and the LMA's team of market professionals, the successful candidate will use their expertise in analysing, researching, editing and drafting wordings through their participation in market projects to review and produce  model wordings. The LMA does not operate directly within a live underwriting environment. The wordings team focusses on project-based work, reviewing and developing LMA model wordings, providing guidance, identifying and drafting coverage options. There is an opportunity  to perform a role that has real breadth and complexity and may feel less formulaic than routine wordings work directly for an insurer or broker. This unique position provides scope to work across all major lines of business written at Lloyd's, producing high-quality model wordings that can have a significant impact at market level. The team works on a wide range of wordings projects, including products designed for consumers/small businesses as well as commercial insurance and reinsurance. Products currently under focus include cyber & AI, contingency and renewable energy. Recent projects include a new War, Confiscation, Riot and Terrorism Exclusion, updates to cyber endorsements for Terrorism & Political Violence, sanctions clauses and US commercial equine insurance. Job Purpose The Executive, Technical Underwriting, will be responsible for representing and promoting the interests of the LMA members and other key stakeholders across the underwriting team's key activities and other business areas as required, focussed on wordings  production and review; a key function of the LMA's Underwriting team. Key Accountabilities  To provide technical support to the LMA committees/business panels/working groups (which will include attendance at some of the underwriting committees), focussing on the drafting and review of LMA model wordings and providing guidance, identifying and promoting  drafting and coverage solutions and ensuring effective execution of actions. To provide effective support to the LMA Wordings Committee & Wordings Forum: Providing technical support re the drafting of LMA model wordings;Arranging/administering meetings of the Wordings Committee and associated Working Groups;Responding to technical enquiries from Members (and others) in a timely and appropriate manner;Undertaking specific Market and/or internal LMA projects and research work as required;Providing technical support for the Lloyd's Wordings Repository, including the wordings held on the LWR. Represent the LMA at meetings and on external groups in such a way as to promote the policies and reputation of the LMA and in the interests of its Members.Listen to and demonstrate understanding of our Members views, building on this to identify solutions, influence outcomes and develop consensus.Maintain current knowledge of initiatives and developments within the LMA, Corporation of Lloyd's and other key areas of the Market. Seek opportunities to support and promote projects internally and externally to the advantage of the LMA Membership.Communicate confidently and effectively to LMA Members, and other key stakeholders, giving guidance on initiatives and developments and ensuring that the LMA's reputation for expertise and as a recognised partner in the Wordings arena is reinforced.Assist with the promotion of the LMA, its brand, and the key wordings activities that it is leading or supporting, identifying PR opportunities (providing input into newsletters, press releases, board reports and the LMA website) and present to colleagues,  members and others.Finally, and in addition to the above key accountabilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the LMA may reasonably require. General skills/Qualities Versatile and inquisitive with a real interest in language, grammar and the meaning of words. Sharp eye for detail and able to review and suggest corrections to wordings documents. Facility to understand potentially complex scenarios and find wording solutions. Willing to help junior members within the team, particularly those completing our Legal Trainee Wordings Scheme. Experience Desirable: Demonstrable relevant wordings experience, ideally having been gained within an insurance company or Lloyd's syndicate/Managing Agent or an organisation dealing with such. Essential: Some experience of insurance or legal work, ideally with an understanding of Contract Law and how it relates to Insurance contracts and knowledge of UK regulation within the insurance industry. Candidates looking to transition to wordings with backgrounds in claims, legal or underwriting will be considered.

Elevate your career and become an integral part of the financial backbone of the nation. Inspire People are working with the Bank of England to seek an experienced Technical Architect with expertise in implementing Microsoft SaaS offerings and working  with Azure. You will lead on major initiatives within Central Services and contribute to the development of the architecture, strategy and roadmaps of products and platforms. Salary of £70,510 - £90,360 plus 8% cash benefits allowance, 10-25% annual bonus,  a non-contributory pension and further benefits. Hybrid working from London or Leeds (2 days a week) and a culture that values work-life balance and professional development. The Technology Directorate helps enable the Bank to deliver on our collective mission to promote the good of the people of the UK by maintaining monetary and financial stability. In Technology, Bank of England (BoE) support a large diverse set of technical  solutions and platforms to deliver services to both the Bank and external users. These include critical systems and services that underpin the UK economy, financial supervision, evolving data analytics, collaboration and research. In this role within Central Cervices you will be responsible for leading a number of programmes including on-prem to Azure migrations whilst implementing Microsoft offerings such as M365, Dynamics, SharePoint Online. and Power Platforms. You must be a critical  thinker, with ability to research and provide summarised results/recommendations whilst being able to prioritise your work, anticipate problems and meet deadlines. Key Responsibilities As a senior member of the Team, you will be: Taking a leading role on programmes and projects, understanding business imperatives and developing solutions that deliver against the requirements aligned to business and technology strategiesContributing to moving the organisation from E3 to E5Responsible for crafting and producing architectural artefacts for end-to-end solutions, baseline and target architectures, solution blueprints, including high-level design that are aligned to architecture standards, principles and patternsA technology ambassador, representing architecture and technology at governance forums and being an advocate for the solutions, strategies and roadmaps produced by the teamResponsible for contributing to the development and maintenance of the architecture building blocks, architecture repository and continuous improvement initiatives.Helping to improve architecture processes and mentor junior architects within the teamEssential Skills Experience of document and records management systems and their implementationsExtensive experience of the Microsoft offerings especially with regards to; M365, Dynamics, SharePoint Online, Power Platforms and moving organisations from E3 to E5Experience in communication and collaboration systems and their implementationsExperience of Azure Cloud implementations and considerations for on-premise V cloud hostedExperience of Productivity and Automation tools and offeringsExperience with different methodologies e.g. agile and/or waterfall environment, proof of concepts and prototypingExperience with sophisticated large scale data and analytics solutions including design of data lifecycle capabilitiesExperience with different database technologies (eg. SQL, NoSQL / time series etc)Desirable Skills Knowledge and exposure of financial regulation / financial services and FTSE 100 organisationExperience of MS Copilots and other related generative AI capabilitiesExperience working with architectural methodologies and frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachman) and experience in architecture modelling toolsAwareness of industry trends across wider technology e.g. RegTech, Cloud, Big data & Analytics, and Cyber security etc.Benefits This specific role offers a base salary of £78,310 - £90,360 London based and £70,501 - £81,360 Leeds based per-annum on full-time basis. In addition, BoE also offer a comprehensive benefits package as detailed below: A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through  our flexible benefits programme each year.A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool (8% - 20%)Guaranteed 8% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.26 days' annual leave with option to buy up to 12 additional days through flexible benefits.Private medical insurance and income protection.Dental coverInterest-free season ticket loanThis role is not just a career move; it's a chance to leave a lasting imprint on the financial landscape of the UK. If you are ready to take on this challenge and possess the required skills and experience, contact Zymante Gintalaite (Zee) at Inspire  People or apply here.

job_desc: Customer Success Consultant, SaaS, Cloud, Software Solutions, Unified Communications, Contact Center, AI, 65-75K Our clients are seeking a focused, customer-driven professional to join their team as a Customer Success Consultant. In this role, you will work closely with our valued clients to understand their challenges and use our existing solutions to enhance their  customer and user experiences. As a Customer Success Consultant, you will collaborate across functions to accelerate customer successes. Your role will be entirely customer-centric, responsible for identifying growth opportunities and leading the Customer Satisfaction framework. The ideal  candidate will be an experienced, senior customer-facing professional with a proven track record of delivering transformational change through effective stakeholder management. Location: This position can be based at either our clients Bracknell, Berkshire, or Glasgow, Scotland offices. As an office-based role, we require candidates to be available for a minimum of 3-4 days per week in the office as part of our hybrid working policy. Key Responsibilities:Customer Relationship Management: Act as an ambassador for exceptional customer experience across all customer-facing departments.Identify and propose customer success criteria, CX and UX opportunities within the bid process.Work closely with key customers to understand their industry, value drivers, and business processes.Train, coach, and mentor colleagues on customer success drivers and CX principles.Organise and host customer workshops to address key challenges and provide solutions that deliver desired outcomes.Adoption, Utilisation, and Customer Satisfaction: Understand customers’ usage of solutions and identify optimisation opportunities.Focus on maximising the value of existing products and solutions.Identify synergies between customer goals and current solution capabilities.Drive customer satisfaction by working across key customer lifecycle moments, addressing development areas, and defining what excellence looks like.Demonstrate the impact of products and services through ROI discussions in reviews and workshops.Identify opportunities to provide additional value by leveraging CX and UX best practices.Collaborate with marketing teams to showcase products, case studies, and facilitate reference opportunities.Driving Improvements: Lead lessons-learned sessions across functions to identify areas for improvement.Set targeted action plans to address root causes and collaborate across teams to ensure delivery.Take ownership of customer escalations, working across teams to resolve issues and improve CX.Provide weekly reviews of customer success impacts and demonstrate how you’ve driven improvements.Research and Insight: Proactively identify key research to maintain your knowledge as a CX/industry expert.Gather insights during customer interactions to enhance our understanding of customer challenges, sharing findings with internal stakeholders.Challenge internal blockers that hinder the delivery of leading CX, working with colleagues to find quick solutions.Analyse data to identify trends and share these insights with relevant teams.About You: Experience in a senior contact centre or customer experience role, such as Head of Contact Centre, Experience, or Insights.Previous consultancy experience in customer experience roles is also suitable.A proactive approach to innovation and improving CX, with proven success in enhancing the customer experience.Strong presentation skills, with experience presenting to diverse audiences and leadership.Ability to develop targeted action plans for improvement based on customer engagement insights.We are looking for dynamic, results-oriented professionals who can lead the way in improving customer experiences and driving success.

job_desc: As a global SaaS business, we have continued to grow from strength to strength, our UK operation requires a new lead to traverse the delicate process of merging family values and traditional methods/products with a hyper modern technological client centric  approach. The opportunity to grow in the company is really backed with an ambitious PE-owner with a global growth agenda.   BASIC SALARY: £130,000 - £150,000   BENEFITS: Commensurate with level of role   Location - Luton   Commutable Locations - this is an office-based role with visits throughout the UK and occasionally Europe.   Why is this role interesting? · A small niche scale up in a growing global market segment within Police and Justice · Take part in exciting journey / expansion phase · The company has a strong brand, with a solid history & a unique position · A great backing from a resourceful PE- setup · Meaningful purpose - serving fairness in society · Dynamic and international working environment · Flat, dynamic, and un-bureaucratic organisational structure with ability to influence   Role Purpose: Managing Director / UK General Manager - SaaS, Law Enforcement   Working closely with both the outgoing owner (retiring) of the UK business and the CEO to ensure the forward movement of the organization. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the business retains the core values that's led to us becoming the UK's Market  Leader of technology tools into the UK law enforcement community, whilst creating a strategic modern approach to sustainable growth whilst increasing enterprise value (ARR)   Key Tasks: Managing Director / UK General Manager - SaaS, Law Enforcement   · Overall responsibility for the full P/L for the UK Business. · Develop UK Business and market shares with new technological products and services such as AI, hybrid solutions hardware and software. · Evangelism for future client centric road maps and future products. · Responsible for building trust with customers, partner development and relationship development, in both new and existing clients · Overall responsibility for the public bid tenders and make sure the UK department has the right kind of talent and procedures to develop, win and serve the tenders. · Must have an ongoing overview of the company's financial position and risks and ensure that the company's asset management is arranged in a reassuring manner. · Stay connected with and development with key partners.     Person Specification: Managing Director / UK General Manager - SaaS, Law Enforcement    To be successful in your application, you will balance the needs of the corporation with the values of the legacy business and workforce. Leadership is of the utmost importance to us, not only as your prospects are to grow and develop but crucially your ability  to succession plan, empower and enthuse others.   · A background which includes time with a corporate/high performing organisation. · A proven track record successfully winning tenders and supply into the UK law enforcement, police, CPS, MOD, immigration and/or Customs & Excise. · Experience from the IT industry within hardware or/both software, SAAS, PAAS or similar, preferable with experience from ARR Business Models · A minimum bachelors degree, preferably an MBA   Company  Established for over 40 years we recently became a part of a global organisation, investing in our product development, wider reach and future growth. With a strong market position we need to continue to be on the front foot. We supply SaaS / Hardware products  to UK police forces and other security/governmental departments.     INTERESTED? Please click apply. You will receive an acknowledgement of your application.   Please Note: Wallace Hind Selection have been chosen as the retained recruitment partner of our client and therefore any direct applications to our client from candidates or agencies will be forwarded on to us direct.   REF: MH17908, Wallace HInd Selection

We're currently on the lookout for a creative Copywriter/Content Writer and Outreach Specialist (with experience in running outreach for link-building and guest blogging campaigns) who will write high-impact, clear and engaging copy for a wide range of online  formats, including articles, press releases, blog posts, guides and web content. You will also be responsible for running outreach campaigns, securing article placements with a range of different bloggers, influencers and online publishers to get the best possible coverage for our clients. Who we are: Solvid is an SEO, Digital PR and Content Marketing agency based in London. We are fortunate to work with some of the most exciting brands all over the world. From online stores and SaaS to fintech and crypto businesses, we help clients get the best possible  coverage. We are a vibrant team of professional Content Marketers, SEOs and Copywriters. Our clients have been featured in Nasdaq, VentureBeat, Business Insider, Entrepreneur.com, Adweek, Bitcoin.com, TechRadar, HuffPost and The Next Web. Who we're looking for: We are looking for a skilled Content Writer with extensive outreach experience who can help us achieve a new high. The successful candidate will work on producing and editing content around SEO (and Digital Marketing in general), Finance, Real Estate, Technology, Retail, Blockchain, AI, Banking, Insurance, Sports, and more. The candidate must be able to produce content  and run outreach campaigns. You should have good knowledge of Content Marketing, Link Building and SEO. You'll be expected to write creative articles, how-to guides, performance hacks, tips, list posts and press releases. We're currently working remotely and continue to do so for the foreseeable future. Key Responsibilities: Producing high-volume, quality content on a daily basisProduce content at a fast paceSecuring high-quality content placements on top blogs and publications (AKA Guest Blogging)Running email outreach and content marketing campaignsRunning link-building outreach campaigns using tools like Ahrefs, Moz and BuzzSumoConducting blogger/influencer email outreach campaignsCoordinating freelance copywritersTracking, analysing and reporting on campaign metricsKey Requirements & Skills: It is essential to demonstrable fluency in EnglishBeing an exceptional CopywriterHave 2+ years of experience producing and promoting quality contentRun email outreach and link-building campaigns - mush show prior outreach experiencePassionate for and in tune with the latest content marketing trendsStrong communication & organisational skillsShould have a fair knowledge of SEO, Digital Marketing & Link BuildingBasic knowledge of WordPress CMSFamiliar with Google AnalyticsStrong journalistic/copywriting skillsAble to multi-task & meet deadlinesTake the initiative, propose topics and juggle multiple tasks simultaneouslyBut we’d prefer a bit more (additional skills): Extensive experience in SEO, Blogging, Digital & Content MarketingExperience in link-building and traffic generationHad your work published/featured on several well-known blogs/publications/websites (please provide links when applying)Have an extensive content portfolioMore Info: Salary: £31,000 - £34,000 per Annum (depending on experience)Type: Permanent, Full Time, Fully Remote (WFH)Hours: 10:00 - 17:30 (Monday - Friday)Holiday: 28 days of paid annual leave + bank holidaysPrivate health and dental insuranceLocation: United Kingdom - remote workWhat to do next? Send us your CV / ResumeProvide a portfolio outlining your experience along with samples of past workSpecify your work pace. For content writing, indicate an approximate word count you're able to produce each day.Job Type: Full-time Pay: £31,000.00-£34,000.00 per year Benefits: Additional leaveCasual dressCompany pensionPrivate dental insurancePrivate medical insuranceSick payWork from home

Your expertise will drive the creation of new digital products,  utilising your deep knowledge and insights in data and technology. You will also be responsible for the operational management of technical services, ensuring efficient delivery and ongoing innovation across our digital and data offerings In this role, you will work collaboratively with the sales and technical teams to deliver exceptional customer service and develop innovative solutions. Your ability to build and lead a high-performing technical team will be crucial as you shape the strategic  direction of our services. This role is ideal for a leader with strong digital and data expertise, a passion for innovation, and the ability to translate technical knowledge into impactful business outcomes. Data Reporting Analyst EC3, London / Hybrid (3 days in the office per week) - WFH / Remote working£45,000 - £55,000 plus excellent benefits including generous pension, private medical, dental, rising holiday, up to 30 days holiday, rising and lots more. Insurance experience required My client is a global reinsurance provider who offers a proven career path, generous staff benefits and a supportive working environment. Due to expansion, they are looking for a talented and motivated Data and Reporting Analyst to join their dynamic global  team. You will have a passion for problem-solving with a strong analytical mindset. Data and Reporting Analyst - Duties and Responsibilities You will play a key role in driving data-driven decision making be responsible for supporting local regulatory and statutory reporting needs. The Data & Reporting Analyst will be responsible for understanding and providing valid, relevant data to key stakeholders, by prioritizing requests, applying assumptions, extracting, organizing and analyzing data from target sources. The analyst will collaborate  with stakeholders and Lead BI developer to build reporting for departmental needs and business objectives. In this role, you will be a key contributor to the organization’s data strategies and be in position to influence the strategic direction of portfolio business. Duties: Help define and create big data analytics framework to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations in large amounts of raw data to help make informed decisions by partnering with stakeholders (Operations, Actuarial, UW, etc.) to design and create data solutions  that will facilitate accessibility to data and evaluation of portfolios.Work with stakeholders to collate, define and document data and reporting requirements to create actionable insights for the organisation.Collaborate with Global Operations team in creating reports to identify and communicate key findings and regular monitoring of key performance indicators.Maintain the data quality and change framework to facilitate iterative feedback and address any issues as it pertains to existing analytical tools and data views.Provide status updates of progress including where additional support is required.Use tools and programming language (e.g.., PowerBI, Palantir, Python, SQL) to consolidate, cleanse and/or transform and present data from various sources.Assist Lead BI developer in validating data solutions (e.g., reconciling, profiling and reviewing against raw source) and dashboard results against Financial and original source BDX filesAnalyse data and identify data quality issues against key monitoring criteria and continually identify new areas of monitoring.Data and Reporting Analyst - Over to You! The Successful Candidate Will Have; Data Analysis experience gained within the insurance industry - required.Strong proficiency in data programming languages such as R, Python and/or SQL.Knowledge of the reinsurance industry preferred (property and casualty, life and health, marine, energies etc.).Experience with data visualization tools (i.e., Power BI).Experience with AI technology and tools (i.e., Matlab, Simulink)Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.In addition, experience in data platforms such as Apache Spark, Databricks, HD Insight and experience working with Data Governance Programs and a Mathematics/Statistics background is preferred.In return, my client offers a proven career path within a structured, global reinsurance provider and excellent benefits including a generous pension, private medical, dental, rising holiday, up to 30 days holiday, rising and lots more. Sound interesting  and something you would love to be part of? Apply today! Integral Recruitment is acting as an employment agency in regard to this vacancy.

job_title: Associate Head of Policy and Public Affairs Online Safety Act
job_desc: Your new companyI am delighted to be working with a Not-for-Profit organisation, and we are looking for an Associate Head of Policy and Public Affairs to head up the Policy, Public Affairs and Research team on a 6-9 month FTC. With a team of six sitting underneath you, in  this short period of time, there will be some key deliverables that the charity will be looking at completing during your contract. This includes passing bills on the Online Safety Act, attending submits and launching a new Policy. This is a fantastic opportunity  for someone who has proven policy leadership who wants to work for a great cause. Your new roleThe successful candidate will: Provide direction, leadership and line management for the Policy and Public Affairs team.Work collaboratively with colleagues within the leadership team and across the organisation to contribute to the delivery of the strategy.Provide leadership as the charity responds to emerging opportunities and threats affecting children's safety online. This will include formalising interim and final policy positions to address reactive issues.Ensuring that the team's policy positions and influencing strategies are evidence based, high quality, impactful and support the strategic ambition to transform the online world so it is safe for children. This will include managing the finalisation and  launch of our Generative AI policy position.Provide support, guidance and challenge to ensure the team delivers and launches cutting edge policy and research on online safety including risks posed by new and emergent technologies. This includes acting as a sounding board to help shape the team's  policy, public affairs and research work.Maintain relationships with civil service, parliamentary and civil society stakeholders and leverage these to amplify our policy impact.Represent the charity on relevant internal and external advisory groups. This can include deputising for senior colleagues.What you'll need to succeed This position is ideal for someone who: Solid understanding of the public policy and regulatory opportunities and challenges relating to online safety (ideally, but not a necessity).Evidence of strong team leadership skills, with experience of line management and leadership.Demonstrable strategic decision-making skills, with experience of weighing up competing options and opportunities to deliver strategic objectives at a senior level in an organisationExcellent evidence-based policymaking skills, mixing strong analytical skills with the ability to understand the wider policy context to turn problems into practical, robust policy solutions.Experience of analysing, comprehending and responding at pace to complex policy and public affairs developments in a fast-moving external environmentExperience of managing complex and competing priorities with a strong track record for delivery at speed and under pressure, responding to tight external deadlines.Strong interpersonal skills, including demonstrable experience of successfully building external influencing networks and dealing effectively and persuasively with senior internal stakeholders.What you'll get in return This FTC is available on a 6-9 month basis. Ideally, the successful candidate will start sooner rather than later to allow for a cross-over from the current post holder before and after they return from their extended period of leave. The salary is £52,084  - £60,271/annum (inc London weighting). Excluding London, the weighting salary is available upon request. Benefits include: 29 days annual leave, plus bank holidays, competitive pension contribution and salary assurance up to five times your salary. What you need to do nowIf you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. Business Development Manager - Defence In support of a growing and firmly established SME organisation within the UK and European Defence and Security sectors designing, manufacturing and supplying Autonomous Sensor Systems,  we are seeking a new Business Development Manager to provide strategic  planning, positioning and generating new business in the defence, security, C-UAS, emergency response and similar markets, focussing primarily on their Sensor Systems. With a high value investment into R&D, my client is seeing considerable growth in product demand for use in critical domains such as defence, surveillance, security, emergency response and counter-UAS, including ground-based solutions and products mounted  on manned and autonomous vehicles. With capabilities in motor design and control, mechanics, electronics, embedded software, AI/ML and sensor integration, plus systems engineering, the Business Development Manager will join the team and provide strategic planning,  positioning and generating new business in the defence, security, C-UAS, emergency response and similar markets.  Focussing primarily on their Sensor Systems they will take the lead in business development on a consultative and solution sales basis. Ideally with exposure from within the defence, security and military sectors and with a relating technical and military application exposure, this growth focused role will hold key responsibilities: -    Maintain understanding of key market trends & programmes and position OV on these. -    Identify new business opportunities including new markets, new customers, new partners and new products. -    Deliver sales targets (revenue and GM). -    Formulating, agreeing and then executing business strategies for markets and customers. -    Customer relationship management - build enduring relationships with customers and users gauging their needs and developing proposals to address these. -    Attending conferences and events to build relationships with customers and partners. -    Revenue forecasting. -    Competitive assessments. -    Defining PTW (Price To Win) and bid strategy. -    Lead bid processes and approvals. -    Ensure the CRM system is up-to-date at all times Personal Profile The Business Development Manager should have/be: -    Significant experience with surveillance & reconnaissance in the security and / or defence environments and in operational use of sensor systems. -    Business development experience gained within a relevant industry. -    Strong personal gravitas. -    Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. -    Commercially astute. Personal Skills -    Driven to achieve both personal and company success. -    Innovative and a self-starter. -    Team player with a start-up mentality - we muck in and win together. -    Keen to understand the big picture and the fine details. -    Ideally be degree qualified or higher - preferably in a technical discipline (Engineering, Maths etc). -    Have worked within the military and understand the environment. Job Reference: /SC/02-10/1315/24 Job Title: Security Officer Location: Fordham Newmarket Pay Rate: £12.03 Hours per week: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday - 06:30 - 18:30, 18:30 - 06:30 - 45 hours per week  Business Overview OCS UK & Ireland is a leading facilities management company with a turnover of £1.7bn and 50,000+ colleagues. We deliver innovative, award-winning services including Cleaning, Catering, Security, Technical Services, Energy Management and compliance, front  of house, landscaping, logistics, waste management and pest control services to the public and private sectors and our mission is to make people and places the best that they can be. Role Overview We are currently recruiting for a Gatehouse Security Officer to join our passionate and driven team based at our client’s site in Fordham, Newmarket You will undertake general gatehouse and security duties. It is a full time role with night shifts during weekdays and weekend day shifts. The site is located away from public transport connections therefore driving to site for your duties will be essential. Your new companyFor 30 years, this organisation has provided top-tier market research and consultancy to the HVAC, refrigeration, and building controls industry. Their technical expertise and deep knowledge of building engineering services ensure high-quality market insights,  trend analysis, and future market dynamics.The WMI Business Manager role offers a unique chance to engage in research, data analysis, and technology assessment, helping to achieve buildings' decarbonisation targets while ensuring commercial success. This position places you at the heart of the industry's  transformation, driven by legislative changes, societal trends, and the rapid growth of IoT and AI, presenting exciting challenges and fostering innovation.Your new roleYou will operate and develop the market intelligence business, contributing to profit, reputation, and mission while delivering excellence to customers. This role involves overseeing WMI operations, collaborating with overseas entities to maximise business  opportunities, and supporting wider commercial interests through partnerships with business managers and directors. Further to this, you will: Lead the WMI team in the UK and internationally, aligning with internal objectives, mission, and values.Deliver top-quality research to grow the market intelligence portfolio, increase profitability, and expand its reputation.Provide vision, set commercial and financial targets, and develop an operational plan.Implement the agreed strategy.Manage budgetary responsibilities (P&L) for WMI, including overseas business.Ensure efficient internal processes and effective interaction with other internal entities.Operate in compliance with corporate policies and support high standards across internal businesses.Maintain excellence in market research standards, ensuring quality, validity, and reliability.Explore opportunities for business development, including new products and services.Represent the organisation at events, exhibitions, and conferences, with international travel as required.Be an active, supportive member of the management team.Perform any other duties as required.What you'll need to succeed Extensive business experience, including financial literacy, strong communication, and leadership skills.In-depth knowledge and experience with research methodologies and their applications.Proficient at generating, managing, and analysing data.Advanced interpersonal skills across societal and business boundaries.Capable of working with international teams across various geographies and cultures.Proficient at using a variety of software packages.Familiarity with the construction and HVAC industry is a plus.A university degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.What you need to do nowIf you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career. job_title: Engineering Team Lead - Data Management & Governance
job_desc: Bloomberg runs on data. As the Data Management & Analytics team within Engineering, we support Bloomberg's needs around managing data efficiently with a vision to ensure that the Right Data is identified and available in the Right Place to the Right People  in the Right Form and at the Right Time. We have embarked on a journey to understand data needs across the organization to help business operations run efficiently, make improved decisions and adhere to regulatory requirements. The Data Management team solves new and upcoming problems in the space of data and risk management building robust and scalable products around data catalog, data classification, data lineage, data quality, reference, and master data management across the organization. Due to the continuous growth and a need to support business globally, we are looking for a Team Lead to build and grow our Data Management team in London. This team will work closely with business partners and engineering teams globally. If you have a passion  towards people management, data management and solving unique challenges, we would love to talk to you! We'll trust you to:Lead and develop a group of both junior and senior engineers, growing them along their career path in order to achieve company and career goalsBrainstorm, develop, communicate and promote vision, strategy and roadmap for all data management and compliance products across BloombergBe a hands-on technical leader and work side-by-side with your team, constantly empowering them to become more effectiveFoster a culture of high quality and strong software development practices in the team Shape our infrastructure for years to come as we transition to better distributed high-performance architectures using vendor tools and open source technologiesCultivate strong relationships with Business and Engineering stakeholdersBuild a high performing, self organizing team culture with trust and integrity as the core pillarsBring the latest and greatest innovation and technology stack features from the open source community to our data products including adopting and implementing AI/ML practicesSet goals, OKRs, provide tailored coaching and mentoring to ensure individual and teams performance is on track to meet departmental goals across multiple metric categories such as productivity and qualityAbility to strategically think forward, identify and assess risks and opportunities in a timely mannerYou'll need to have:Experience in engineering leadership, managing and coaching global teams and influencing technology strategyHands-on software development experience in Python and any other programming language developing applications based on microservices architectureExperience driving strategies, managing sophisticated projects, and leadership ability in change management or influencing othersGreat interpersonal skills, allowing you to build relationships and clearly communicate business needs and to advocate on behalf of your teamCreative and flexible approach to problem solving, aided by strong data analysis skillsA degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, similar field of study or equivalent work experience.We'd love to see:Experience building relationships with vendors and implementing 3rd party applicationsPrevious hands-on work with a microservice architectural style building large distributed systems or high volume / low latency productsFamiliarity with third party open source technologies such as Kafka, Cassandra, RedisFamiliarity with web standards and browser related technologies.Experience with scheduling tools (Airflow, Argo etc.)

Wehave an exciting opportunityavailable for a Programme Coordinator to join one of the world’s leading research Institutes at a crucial time in its evolution, and play a definitive role in shaping it for the future. You will join us on afull  time (or possibly 0.8 FTE) fixed-term position until December 2025, and in return, you will receive a competitive salary from £27,000 per annum, subject to skills and experience. The Programme Coordinator role: The KQ Labs accelerator programme, an initiative delivered by the Francis Crick Institute, is seeking a highly organised and proactive Coordinator to support the efficient operation of its accelerator programme. This role requires an individual with strong  operational skills, and the ability to represent KQ Labs while facilitating the delivery of a world-class accelerator programme. You will be part of a driven, energetic, and agile team. The role is centred around providing vital coordination and support to ensure the successful delivery of our accelerator programme. You will collaborate in guiding the cohort through the next curriculum, coordinate legal administration and manage impact  reporting, and support event logistics, marketing and operations. Since its inception in 2018, KQ Labs has been committed to developing a network of startups at the intersection of data science and biomedical research. Our tailored five-month programme includes expert workshops, funding opportunities, skills training,  and strategic networking, culminating in a Demo Day where startups connect with investors and industry leaders. Responsibilities of our Programme Coordinator: These include but are not limited to:  Provide proactive and effective coordination support to the KQ Labs team, ensuring seamless operations of the accelerator programme and curriculumManage legal administration tasks to process the £40k convertible loans, including document management and liaising signatures with various stakeholdersManage and update spreadsheets on our impact, conduct research to keep financial data on our alumni current, and produce charts and summaries based on that information for the KQ Labs team and stakeholdersSupport the Events and Community Officer with logistical and operational support for KQ Labs events and community managementAttend all curriculum events to ensure smooth execution and a positive experience for all attendeesSupport marketing and outreach efforts, including posting on social media to enhance our brand presence and engage with the communityEfficiently process invoices, expenses, payments and financesAnswer queries, compose and answer routine correspondence, type and proofread/format documents on requestSkills and experience we are looking for in our Programme Coordinator: Strong organisational skills and the ability to prioritise in the face of competing prioritiesDemonstrable ability to manage large volumes of data and produce reports with that informationExcellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with stakeholders at all levelsAbility to show initiative and management of own workloadDemonstrable ability to efficiently manage multiple, concurrent activities in a fast-paced environmentPrevious administrative experience including exceptional time management skills and attention to detail Proficiency in MS Office and excellent administrative and IT skillsThe ability to deal with sensitive information in a confidential mannerClosing date: 10/Nov/2024 23.59 GMT If you feel you have the skills and experience to become our Programme Coordinator, please click ‘apply’ today, we’d love to hear from you! All offers of employment are subject to successful security screening and continuous eligibility to work in the United Kingdom.

A global brand name business with a large European finance team based in Bracknell are looking for a FP&A Manager to lead a team. This roles is responsible for the analysis of monthly results, top-level coordination of all budgeting and forecasting (short  and long term), plus general commercial finance decision support to the European business. The team supports both Head Office and the wider European region and its ultimate aim is to help maximise profit and achieve budget accuracy across the business. Responsibilities: Coordinate the budgeting process for the European region, ensuring alignment with division objectives and providing guidance to budget preparers.Set targets for Europe (interpret company targets and present to Regional Operating Committee for approval, inc. division splitsSupport Head Office business teams in preparation of their budgets.Contribute to Direct GA budgets for Head Office and work with Business Unit Department Managers to ensure branch GA is prepared accurately and consistently.Monitor and communicate budget performance against present targets.Review SGA budgets for quality (phasing, granularity etc.). Challenge assumptions where appropriate.Manage 'top-level adjustment' tracker and ensure balance between capturing risk whilst not being overly prudent is correct.Scenario modelling and sensitivity analysis to test the robustness of budgeted results and search for opportunities to increase profit.Maintain and enhance financial models, tools and systems to support budgeting and forecasting, working with the Head of European FP&A and wider FP&A team to achieve standardisation where possible. Lead the pursuit of standardisation between divisions and  across branches. This will include considering the use of rolling forecasts.Lead development of accurate Balance Sheet budgeting, including loan forecastSupport business reviews with company divisions.Key point of contact in Finance for Head Office product division financial matters.Input financial expertise to relevant business projects relating to direct divisions.Support projects, ensuring ROI is accurately determined and investment decisions thus make good financial sense.Requirements: Qualified accountant - CIMA, ACCA, ACA or equivalentExperience of managing an FP&A teamExperience of FP&A for a large/complex business (ideally with an international remit)Experience of business partnering senior stakeholdersEvidence of process improvement and adding valueA curiosity, willingness and aptitude to investigate and learn the latest tech solutions to support FP&A activities (e.g. Power BI, Power Query, RPA, AI etc.)

job_title: Building Services Engineer - Electrical Foot mobile
job_desc: Join Our Team as an Electrical foot Mobile Maintenance Engineer!  You will receive a travel card for zones 1 & 2 and will look after a number of buildings in this area.   Are you ready to take the next step in your career? We are a leading company in the development and construction industry, with a rich history spanning over 135 years and a strong presence in the UK. With 3,300 experts on our team, we offer a dynamic and  supportive work environment. About Us: Our Building Services division provides comprehensive Facilities Management across the UK. We offer mechanical and electrical engineering support, cleaning, catering, and grounds maintenance on both a planned and reactive basis.  We leverage cutting-edge technological solutions to manage our teams efficiently. The Role: We are seeking an Electrical Mobile Maintenance Engineer to join our Commercial Property Maintenance team. This role involves servicing commercial buildings throughout zones 1 and 2 of London. All tools and materials are provided  on-site. Responsibilities: Conduct PPM and planned maintenance, response, and fault analysis.Perform fault finding and plant adjustments, inspect electrical/mechanical services, plant, and systems, and complete maintenance tasks as per contract specifications.Carry out multi-skilled duties, including re-lamping luminaires, fault finding in electrical wiring systems, motors, generators, lighting systems, chillers, AHUs, and cleaning foul water systems, drains, and more.Conduct reactive and extra work requirements in line with engineering standards and HASAWA legislation.Adhere to Health & Safety Policies and statutory obligations.Ensure timely completion and submission of daily work sheets and maintenance records.Participate in the out-of-hours rota.Become an AP for your site(s) if required.Requirements: Electrical City & Guilds, Part 1 and 2 or equivalent qualifications.BMS experience and multi-skilling capability.Health & Safety IOSH Working Safely qualification or similar.Experience in a customer-facing role.Ability to work independently and as part of a team.Strong time management skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Equal Opportunities: We embrace diversity in all its forms, including social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation, and any other protected characteristic. We believe that diversity  fosters innovative thinking and helps us build successful, high-performing teams. Flexible Working: We welcome discussions about flexibility at the interview stage and will explore what is possible for the role. Does this look good to you? Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Programming? Skills shortages in the IT sector are driving the need for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers. We help place graduates from this programme in top UK companies and organisations needing to employ entry-level Programming staff that can hit the ground running with up-to-date skills gained from this programme. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as fully accredited training, which includes tutor support and mentoring, provides you with the skills, practical knowledge and qualifications for you to secure a professional job and career in coding.  You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (£25K-£40K) upon completion. Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks or a few months (step 1 to 4 below). Your job and career goals are completed in  4 easy steps. Step 1 -HTML and CSS Online Training (*12 weeks) The first step is completing a selection of professional and industry-recognised courses. We have carefully selected these courses to give you the most out of both your learning and employment journey.  HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. You will also be assigned an expert tutor and a support mentor to help you throughout your training. Once the HTML & CSS courses are complete, you will be ready to move forward. Step 2 -Online Training (*12 weeks) The second step includes a selection of more advanced courses to get you up to speed.  Learn the Command Line (1.5 weeks)  Learn Git & GitHub (1.5 weeks)  Learn JavaScript (1.5 weeks)  Learn Python 3 (1.5 weeks) JavaScript forms the foundation of almost everything you see on the Internet, so it will be essential! Python is highly versatile. You can use it for both small and complex tasks, and it is used across many different industries. Step 3 - Build a Portfolio Website Project (1 week) Additional Courses  AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate Step 4 - Junior Programmer placement (£25K - £40k) We work with you to secure your first role as a Junior Programmer, with a starting salary of anywhere between £25K - £40k. While working as a Junior Programmer, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to  move into the programming field. Programmer Role Once you have completed all the mandatory training in step four and have gained two plus years experience in the coding industry, you will be ready to move into higher paying programming roles. Our recruitment support team specialises in the Web and programming  space and roles at this level have an average starting salary of £45K. We have been helping career changers and new career seekers gain new careers since 2009 and we are a CompTIA Gold Partner, accredited by the BCS (Chartered Institute of IT/ British Computer Society) to ensure we provide the highest levels of training. In addition, we are also ELCAS approved to help members of the Armed Forces, Service Leavers and Veterans gain rewarding careers in IT and Cybersecurity. Job Guarantee Due to the success of this programme and the skills shortage of entry-level coding staff, we can guarantee you will secure a job upon completion of your study programme or we will refund you 100% of your course fees back. This is subject to our terms of  learning/ terms of business. Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch. Keywords: Website, Web Developer, Business Development, Website, Web Design, Front End, Back End, Full Stack, Computer Programmer, Computer Systems Engineer, Systems Analyst, Programmer Analyst, Database Administrator, Front-end Developer, Mobile App Developer,  Software Developer, Data Scientist, Cloud Engineer.

You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (£25K-£40K) upon completion. Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks or a few months (step 1 to 4 below). Your job and career goals are completed in  4 easy steps. Step 1 -HTML and CSS Online Training (*12 weeks) The first step is completing a selection of professional and industry-recognised courses. We have carefully selected these courses to give you the most out of both your learning and employment journey.  HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. You will also be assigned an expert tutor and a support mentor to help you throughout your training. Once the HTML & CSS courses are complete, you will be ready to move forward. Step 2 -Online Training (*12 weeks) The second step includes a selection of more advanced courses to get you up to speed.  Learn the Command Line (1.5 weeks)  Learn Git & GitHub (1.5 weeks)  Learn JavaScript (1.5 weeks)  Learn Python 3 (1.5 weeks) JavaScript forms the foundation of almost everything you see on the Internet, so it will be essential! Python is highly versatile. You can use it for both small and complex tasks, and it is used across many different industries. Step 3 - Build a Portfolio Website Project (1 week) Additional Courses  AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate Step 4 - Junior Programmer placement (£25K - £40k) We work with you to secure your first role as a Junior Programmer, with a starting salary of anywhere between £25K - £40k. While working as a Junior Programmer, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to  move into the programming field. Programmer Role Once you have completed all the mandatory training in step four and have gained two plus years experience in the coding industry, you will be ready to move into higher paying programming roles. Our recruitment support team specialises in the Web and programming  space and roles at this level have an average starting salary of £45K. We have been helping career changers and new career seekers gain new careers since 2009 and we are a CompTIA Gold Partner, accredited by the BCS (Chartered Institute of IT/ British Computer Society) to ensure we provide the highest levels of training. In addition, we are also ELCAS approved to help members of the Armed Forces, Service Leavers and Veterans gain rewarding careers in IT and Cybersecurity. Job Guarantee Due to the success of this programme and the skills shortage of entry-level coding staff, we can guarantee you will secure a job upon completion of your study programme or we will refund you 100% of your course fees back. This is subject to our terms of  learning/ terms of business. Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch. Keywords: Website, Web Developer, Business Development, Website, Web Design, Front End, Back End, Full Stack, Computer Programmer, Computer Systems Engineer, Systems Analyst, Programmer Analyst, Database Administrator, Front-end Developer, Mobile App Developer,  Software Developer, Data Scientist, Cloud Engineer.

HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. Location postcode: SL3 0EGSalary: £42,000-£46,500 per annumContract: Full-time, permanentWorking hours: Average 44 hours, normally 7am-4.30pm, Mon-Fri, plus 1 in 3 Saturday mornings, 7am-11.30am Our Transport Manager has been promoted so could you be the new Roy? job_title: Technical Product Manager- BQuant Go to Market
job_desc: Who we are:The Bloomberg CTO Office is the future-looking technical and product arm of Bloomberg L.P. We envision, design, and prototype the next generation infrastructure, hardware, and applications. We are passionate about what we do. What we do:At Bloomberg, we have the richest and most comprehensive financial datasets and analytics in the world. Our powerful enterprise products serve a large and diverse client base from data intensive analytics to trading. The Bloomberg Quant Platform (BQuant) is  the frontier of our work - a platform for quantitative finance professionals to rapidly analyze data and research trading strategies. The BQuant platform brings both data and tools to the larger audience of Bloomberg users. It combines cutting-edge Machine Learning (ML) and quant techniques with financial domain expertise to empower clients to perform collaborative quant research and deploy  production workflows integrated with our deep stack of enterprise products. This revolutionary product is enabling clients to rapidly accelerate their research-to-production cycle and achieve an edge in the market. The roleWe are looking for a BQuant Go to Market Technical Product Manager to join our growing product team. We'll trust you to:As a BQuant Go To Market Product Manager, you'll be responsible for: Development of partnerships with 3rd parties to accelerate the BQuant roadmap with new data or technology partners working closely with senior leadership, legal and CFO teams; Define and articulate a compelling vision for how clients can use BQuant for new workflows based on the Product roadmap; Conduct analysis on our customer/ firm profiles, analyze client feedback and requirements to identify new workflows and opportunities to expand the userbase of BQuant; Work with the BQuant Product team to develop BQuant notebooks to enhance the BQuant pitch and value proposition that can be shared with sales and implementation team; Work closely with clients and prospective clients to demonstrate and articulate the value of BQuant Enterprise to more sophisticated workflows; Work with the BQuant Product teams and key development partner clients to explore and prototype new workflows on the BQuant roadmap with prospective clients; Build relationships with teams across the organization to align efforts from many departments, including our sales, implementation teams to grow the market presence of BQuant. You'll need to have:10+ years of financial industry experience in roles working with front office quant researchers or have a strong understanding and experience of getting an idea from research to execution; Strong familiarity with Python, especially Jupyter notebooks and Pandas; Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to communicate effectively to senior executives and end users; Be a great collaborator, work well across a broad range of teams; Willingness to roll up your sleeves and help out even when it's not in your job description. We'd love to see:Experience with Spark, ML/ AI technologies, public cloud providers such as AWS or Azure. Experience working with intraday, realtime or textual datasets in a financial research context.

job_desc: Head of Product - Business Intelligence  £80,000 - £100,000 + Bonus Hybrid Working London Our client is a highly respected business intelligence provider for the Digital Infrastructure sector and due to recent company growth they are looking for a Head of Product Development. As Head of Product, you'll lead the evolution of their product experience, driving innovation to meet the evolving needs of their customers. This role is ideal for a strategic thinker who thrives on both big-picture vision and hands-on execution. As a seasoned Product leader, you'll play a key role in advancing their product platform and tools to create a world-class user experience. You'll lead research experiments, leveraging your deep understanding of product principles, engineering practices, and the media landscape to drive innovation. Responsibilities  Define and communicate the product vision, aligning it with industry insights and internal stakeholder needs.Gather and prioritise ideas from industry trends and internal sources, shaping use-cases for AI-powered products.Foster a culture of experimentation within your team and across the organization to drive innovation.Work closely with senior leadership team, foster a product led culture into the organisation.Manage and help coordinate product development activities with their in-house and agency team of software developers.Collaborate with Editorial to support use-case development for internal and external customers.Set clear priorities aligned with customer and business needs, rallying the team to achieve objectives.Partner with cross-functional teams using agile methodologies to optimize product experiences.Effectively communicate product developments and vision to stakeholders at all levels of the organisation.What we are looking for  Product Development: Proven track record of building exceptional products and user experiences, with 10+ years of experience - ideally subscription led business intelligence platformsUnderstanding Needs: Strong ability to understand user and business needs through active listening.Documentation: Proficient in documenting user stories, use cases, and requirements with attention to detail.Communication: Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate product vision to teams and stakeholders.Domain Knowledge: Understanding of content-led websites and a passion for the news and media industry.Technical Aptitude: Ability to grasp technical details to optimize product performance.Lipton Media is a specialist media recruitment agency based in London. We specialise in all forms of b2b media sales including conferences, exhibitions, awards, summits, publishing, digital, outdoor, TV, radio and business intelligence. Our clients range from small start-up companies to FTSE 100 and 250 businesses. We work with people at every stage of their career from undergraduates looking for their first entry point into sales to senior managers and directors looking for  their next challenge.
