Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Programming? Skills shortages in the IT sector are driving the need for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers. We help place graduates from this programme in top UK companies and organisations needing to employ entry-level Programming staff that can hit the ground running with up-to-date skills gained from this programme. The best part is you will not need any previous experience as fully accredited training, which includes tutor support and mentoring, provides you with the skills, practical knowledge and qualifications for you to secure a professional job and career in coding.  You will also have the reassurance of a job guarantee (£25K-£40K) upon completion. Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks or a few months (step 1 to 4 below). Your job and career goals are completed in  4 easy steps. Step 1 -HTML and CSS Online Training (*12 weeks) The first step is completing a selection of professional and industry-recognised courses. We have carefully selected these courses to give you the most out of both your learning and employment journey.  HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. You will also be assigned an expert tutor and a support mentor to help you throughout your training. Once the HTML & CSS courses are complete, you will be ready to move forward. Step 2 -Online Training (*12 weeks) The second step includes a selection of more advanced courses to get you up to speed.  Learn the Command Line (1.5 weeks)  Learn Git & GitHub (1.5 weeks)  Learn JavaScript (1.5 weeks)  Learn Python 3 (1.5 weeks) JavaScript forms the foundation of almost everything you see on the Internet, so it will be essential! Python is highly versatile. You can use it for both small and complex tasks, and it is used across many different industries. Step 3 - Build a Portfolio Website Project (1 week) Additional Courses  AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate Step 4 - Junior Programmer placement (£25K - £40k) We work with you to secure your first role as a Junior Programmer, with a starting salary of anywhere between £25K - £40k. While working as a Junior Programmer, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to  move into the programming field. Programmer Role Once you have completed all the mandatory training in step four and have gained two plus years experience in the coding industry, you will be ready to move into higher paying programming roles. Our recruitment support team specialises in the Web and programming  space and roles at this level have an average starting salary of £45K. We have been helping career changers and new career seekers gain new careers since 2009 and we are a CompTIA Gold Partner, accredited by the BCS (Chartered Institute of IT/ British Computer Society) to ensure we provide the highest levels of training. In addition, we are also ELCAS approved to help members of the Armed Forces, Service Leavers and Veterans gain rewarding careers in IT and Cybersecurity. Job Guarantee Due to the success of this programme and the skills shortage of entry-level coding staff, we can guarantee you will secure a job upon completion of your study programme or we will refund you 100% of your course fees back. This is subject to our terms of  learning/ terms of business. Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch. Keywords: Website, Web Developer, Business Development, Website, Web Design, Front End, Back End, Full Stack, Computer Programmer, Computer Systems Engineer, Systems Analyst, Programmer Analyst, Database Administrator, Front-end Developer, Mobile App Developer,  Software Developer, Data Scientist, Cloud Engineer.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks or a few months (step 1 to 4 below). Your job and career goals are completed in  4 easy steps. Step 1 -HTML and CSS Online Training (*12 weeks) The first step is completing a selection of professional and industry-recognised courses. We have carefully selected these courses to give you the most out of both your learning and employment journey.  HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. You will also be assigned an expert tutor and a support mentor to help you throughout your training. Once the HTML & CSS courses are complete, you will be ready to move forward. Step 2 -Online Training (*12 weeks) The second step includes a selection of more advanced courses to get you up to speed.  Learn the Command Line (1.5 weeks)  Learn Git & GitHub (1.5 weeks)  Learn JavaScript (1.5 weeks)  Learn Python 3 (1.5 weeks) JavaScript forms the foundation of almost everything you see on the Internet, so it will be essential! Python is highly versatile. You can use it for both small and complex tasks, and it is used across many different industries. Step 3 - Build a Portfolio Website Project (1 week) Additional Courses  AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate Step 4 - Junior Programmer placement (£25K - £40k) We work with you to secure your first role as a Junior Programmer, with a starting salary of anywhere between £25K - £40k. While working as a Junior Programmer, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to  move into the programming field. Programmer Role Once you have completed all the mandatory training in step four and have gained two plus years experience in the coding industry, you will be ready to move into higher paying programming roles. Our recruitment support team specialises in the Web and programming  space and roles at this level have an average starting salary of £45K. We have been helping career changers and new career seekers gain new careers since 2009 and we are a CompTIA Gold Partner, accredited by the BCS (Chartered Institute of IT/ British Computer Society) to ensure we provide the highest levels of training. In addition, we are also ELCAS approved to help members of the Armed Forces, Service Leavers and Veterans gain rewarding careers in IT and Cybersecurity. We have carefully selected these courses to give you the most out of both your learning and employment journey.  HTML Essentials (6 weeks)  CSS Essentials (6 weeks) The training is delivered via multimedia rich video tutorials, presentations and quizzes through a portal that you study online from anywhere you choose. You will also be assigned an expert tutor and a support mentor to help you throughout your training. Once the HTML & CSS courses are complete, you will be ready to move forward. Step 2 -Online Training (*12 weeks) The second step includes a selection of more advanced courses to get you up to speed.  Learn the Command Line (1.5 weeks)  Learn Git & GitHub (1.5 weeks)  Learn JavaScript (1.5 weeks)  Learn Python 3 (1.5 weeks) JavaScript forms the foundation of almost everything you see on the Internet, so it will be essential! Python is highly versatile. You can use it for both small and complex tasks, and it is used across many different industries. Step 3 - Build a Portfolio Website Project (1 week) Additional Courses  AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner  Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate Step 4 - Junior Programmer placement (£25K - £40k) We work with you to secure your first role as a Junior Programmer, with a starting salary of anywhere between £25K - £40k. While working as a Junior Programmer, we will release your second batch of training which is specifically designed to qualify you to  move into the programming field. Programmer Role Once you have completed all the mandatory training in step four and have gained two plus years experience in the coding industry, you will be ready to move into higher paying programming roles. Our recruitment support team specialises in the Web and programming  space and roles at this level have an average starting salary of £45K. We have been helping career changers and new career seekers gain new careers since 2009 and we are a CompTIA Gold Partner, accredited by the BCS (Chartered Institute of IT/ British Computer Society) to ensure we provide the highest levels of training. In addition, we are also ELCAS approved to help members of the Armed Forces, Service Leavers and Veterans gain rewarding careers in IT and Cybersecurity. Job Guarantee Due to the success of this programme and the skills shortage of entry-level coding staff, we can guarantee you will secure a job upon completion of your study programme or we will refund you 100% of your course fees back. This is subject to our terms of  learning/ terms of business. Passionate about starting a career in coding? Apply now and one of our friendly advisors will be in touch. job_title: Investment Data & Operations Analyst, Renewable Energy
job_desc: Our client, a renowned renewable energy investment firm based in iconic offices in London, has an exciting opportunity for an Investment Data & Operations Analyst to join and support a close-knit and dynamic investment team focused on sustainability. Your role responsibilities will be wide and will include overseeing the firm's fund operations and equity trade processing performed by third-party administrators. These processes are largely automated, requiring strong problem-solving skills to investigate  and resolve trade fails and exception management. The role involves extensive interaction with the investment team and requires strong Data Analysis and Reporting experience using SQL/Tableau. You will work with the front office to provide data requests, automate  processes, lead fund launches and other exciting projects which will appeal to individuals with a curious mindset. This role will suit tech-savvy candidates with strong Excel skills. This role is ideal for candidates who are highly motivated to seek better ways of doing things, add value, and automate processes. Candidates will possess strong problem-solving abilities, be idea-driven, and have a genuine interest in working with data, producing  thoughtful data insights and reporting. The business encourages new ideas and suggestions to improve the company as a whole, whether that involves recommending building an AI tool, creating customised charts in Tableau for the investment team, or participating  in investment strategy meetings. The opportunities are endless. Additionally, the investment team and operations are closely integrated, offering enormous exposure to the investment team. The team is a small, collegiate team where all members contribute across all functions and are part of a larger, highly reputable parent  company, providing a solid foundation and extensive resources.To be considered, candidates will be degree-educated with some working experience in operations or data analysis within a financial services firm. In return, our client offers a competitive salary, bonus potential, an attractive benefits package, hybrid working, career progression for top performers, and the opportunity to work in an iconic London office. Additionally, full study support is offered for  relevant industry qualifications such as IMC or CFA. You may also travel for provider service reviews to Dublin and Luxembourg. This is a rare opportunity to work closely with the investment team in a forward-thinking boutique investment firm with a focus on sustainability. Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

USPs  ·Start up in the Fraud/risk intelligence security space who are the leader in APAC ·Looking to grow the team in EMEA which is in its infancy ·They are Series B having received $20million in funding in bringing their total to $25.5million in funding, this is a great opportunity for someone if they are successful to grow and develop the business as well as their own skills. You could move into  a closing role or even Customer Success ·They offer an end to end solutions or plug in and play type solution giving them a competitive edge over their competitors Company Profile They are a mobile-first risk intelligence company. They help world-leading enterprises build trust and safety by stopping fraud and abuse. PRODUCTS / SERVICES (Web)  ·Device Intelligence ·Device Fingerprinting that Stops Fraud, Builds Trust & Drives Growth ·AdShield ·Protect ad spend, optimize customer acquisition costs, and prevent skewed analytics ·Feature AI Engine ·Stay ahead of complex fraud threats with our no-code feature engineering suite ROLE  Key responsibilities:  ·Partner with the Sales Team to introduce products and solutions to prospects ·Develop an understanding of the prospect's needs and design high-quality presentations that meet their requirements ·Author comprehensive business and technical collateral ·Provide support to the Partner ecosystems in creating a best fit solution for prospects / customers ·Prepare and deliver product demonstrations emphasizing on the key values of solution to prospects ·Understand the technical environment, technology landscape, business requirements and evaluation scope ·Be the trusted tech advisor for customers, partners and other teams ·Markets: Tech, App companies, eCommerce businesses- Mid-Market/Enterprise ·Level of Negotiation: Heads of Fraud, Risk and Security ·Territory Covered: EMEA ·Working location: London, Shoreditch - Hybrid PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES  ·Minimum Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field ·Minimum 3 years of Technical Account Management, Sales engineering or Support engineering experience in the B2B enterprise Software / SaaS / payments industry ·Good knowledge in HTTP, JavaScript, RESTful APIs, JSON, OAuth and SQL ·Strong customer focus with an ability to manage multiple priorities and perform in a fast-paced work environment ·Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate and present technical concepts to both technical and business audience *Additional European language skill would be advantageous

Senior Portfolio Manager - £80k base + 5K car allowance and benefits London - hybrid working  You will be joining a popular British fashion retailer with a chain of high street shops who have grown to be a multichannel brand offering on-trend, value driven fashion. Job purpose: Responsible for driving, prioritising and managing a portfolio of large-scale, cross-functional transformation initiatives (most often leveraging technology) to enhance business performance and deliver strategic priorities. This role requires a blend of strategic leadershipportfolio management expertisedeep understanding of both business and technology landscapes to successfully lead digital transformation efforts.The ideal candidate will oversee the prioritisation and alignment of solutions with business objectives, ensuring investments are delivered on time, within scope, and with maximum value realisation. The role will sit across both the 'demand' and 'supply' sides of the portfolio ensuring there is: On the demand-side, accurate and timely visibility of information regarding business transformation requirements and outcomes.On the supply-side, visibility of available capabilities and capacity to fulfil business demand.Responsibilities: Portfolio Management: Lead and manage the entire transformation portfolio plan.Strategic leadership: Serve as a trusted advisor to stakeholders, develop and execute a transformation roadmap for different initiatives e.g. optimised ROI.Delivery Assurance: Provide an objective, independent review of a project's progress, performance, and alignment with business goals.Stakeholder Engagement & Communication: building strong relationships with business leaders and serving as the point of contact.Risk management & governance: establishing governance framework to monitor risks associated with transformation initiatives.Financial Oversight: Manage the financial performance of the transformation portfolio, ensuring budgetary constraints and opportunities are clearly understoodChange Management: leading the change management efforts, developing and executing communication & training.Skills required for the role: Experience in portfolio management, digital transformation, or business strategy roles.Knowledge of project management methodologies e.g. Agile, Scrum & Waterfall understanding of digital technologies (cloud, data analytics, AI, automation)Experience in managing large budgets and driving ROIIf you are interested in the role and have the desired skills and experience, please respond to this advert by following the link below and attaching a copy of your most recent CV. If successful we will be in touch to discuss the role in more detail. Carbon60, Lorien & SRG - The Impellam Group STEM Portfolio are acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Tech LeadLocation: Remote - with occasional travel to the business unit Salary: CompetitiveWe are the Citation Group. We provide mission-critical software and services, helping small and medium-sized businesses and economies thrive.We have been building foundations to ensure we have a highly scalable global business that will grow for decades to come. What You'll Do:* Architect complex, scalable solutions for SME-focused HR and H&S services* Lead technical decisions and shape our tech strategy* Mentor high-performers and build world-class engineering teams* Directly impact business outcomes through cutting-edge tech initiatives* Leverage and integrate the latest AI assistants and tools to boost productivity and code qualityYour Expertise:* Senior Software Engineer background* Strong .NET, Azure, and DevOps experience* Champion of TDD, BDD, and quality-driven development* Practiced in implementing automated testing and continuous delivery* Evidence of integrating secure software development best practices* Experience with Infrastructure as Code and containerisationWhy Citation?* Remote work in a fast-paced environment, still maintaining a good work-life balance* Continuous learning and growth opportunities* Growing company with exciting projects* Collaborative culture with group-wide colleagues to support youHere's a taste of the perks we roll out for our extraordinary team members:25 Days of Holiday: We're talking sun-soaked beaches, snow-capped mountains, or simply your favourite cozy spot at home. Take your well-deserved break with 25 days of holiday, plus those cherished bank holidays. Birthday Bliss: Your birthday isn't just another day on the calendar; it's YOUR day! Enjoy it in style with a day off, because at Citation, we believe in celebrating YOU. Post-Wedding Bliss: Newlyweds, we've got something special for you too! Extra weeks of holiday to bask in the glow of post-wedding happiness. Growing Families: We're all about supporting our Citation family, and that includes expectant parents. Vouchers and special perks await to celebrate the newest addition to your family. Healthcare cash plan: Your well-being is our priority. That's why we offer private healthcare to ensure your peace of mind and keep you feeling your best.Ready to lead, innovate, and make a real difference? Join our award-winning team!#TechLeadership #RemoteWork #InnovationDriversHit Apply now to forward your CV.

Full Stack Developer with C# / .Net / React / Azure Cloud for SaaS development.Fast-growing accredited MS Gold Partner with clients both UK and EMEA.North London office but remote working or hybrid also considered. Due to accelerated growth across the EMEA region, our client is now looking for a Full Stack React Developer to add to their small, friendly, collaborative team to contribute to the delivery of their innovative solutions and continuing long-term growth. The Company We are a fast-growing multi-discipline tech consultancy. We are primarily a Software House, but also a Microsoft Gold Partner and Cloud Solution Provider. We are a small friendly team, and we work in a fun, inclusive ‘non-corporate’ environment based in a thriving  social part of North London. You will have access to complimentary fruits, snacks, and soft drinks when working from the office. This is a very exciting role with varied work and lots to get involved with, there is never a dull moment. Not only will this role  give you exposure to the full life cycle of an established SaaS product serving over 8 million requests per hour around the clock to customers around the world, but you will also be involved in new product development, the creation of new SaaS products, and  working with AI/ML and the Microsoft Azure cloud. YouThe successful candidate will be a technology focused dynamic, talented, and enthusiastic Full Stack C#/.Net React Developer with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Reliable and taking pride in producing top quality work, you have an aptitude  for problem solving and be confident in your ability to overcome unforeseen obstacles. You respect policies and procedures. You are a good, analytical team player, self-driven, and committed to your continuous personal professional development. You thrive  on success and learn from failure. Essential Experience: A 1st or 2:1 degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a closely related discipline or other relevant IT qualifications.5+ years’ direct commercial experience in software development at a software company or other relevant commercial experienceA passion for technology.Good attention to detail.Good communication skills.Evidence of experience in web application development.Strong knowledge of React Development full stack with C# .NET, HTML and CSS.Extensive experience working with RESTful APIsAdditional knowledge of JavaScript, jQuery, MS-SQL databases and T-SQL also useful

job_title: Mobile Solution B2B Key Account Manager
job_desc: Our client, a prominent player in the technology sector, is actively seeking a Mobile Solution B2B Key Account Manager to join their dynamic team in Surrey. This permanent role involves driving sales of mobile solutions and MX products, catering to large  accounts in the UK. Working closely with various departments, you will support and enhance client relationships, foster market growth strategies, and align with their mission. Key Responsibilities: Exceed sales and profit targets within the mobile solution and MX Large Account channels.Retain long-term customer relationships and generate demand from new prospects.Facilitate liaison between customers and company departments to ensure top-notch service.Provide ongoing support to high-value clients and identify new revenue opportunities.Develop and maintain strategic business relationships to promote brand awareness.Manage commercial negotiations, contracts, and effective delivery of solutions and products.Collaborate with Pre-Sales to provide technical expertise, demonstrations, and customisations.Manage sales forecasting, inventory management, and monitor sales volumes and costs.Job Requirements: Professional background in B2B sales with mobile solutions and products is essential.Experience in developing relationships with large accounts in the UK market.Excellent written and oral communication skills in English.Proficiency in MS Office tools.Preferred experience in complex sales and technical innovation, such as 5G and AI.Familiarity with consultative selling approaches across various industries is advantageous.Benefits: 25 days of annual leaveDefined Contribution PensionPermanent Health InsurancePrivate Medical Insurance4x Life AssuranceFlexible Benefits allowance, e.g., gym, travel insurance, health assessment, dental insurance (following successful probation period)If you are an experienced B2B sales professional with a passion for mobile solutions and technology, we encourage you to apply now to join our client's team in Surrey.

Electronics Engineer Consultant - Security Clearance - Cambridge A new design consultancy, based in Cambridge, are currently looking for a Electronics Engineer Consultant to add to the team of experienced experts, specifically with a focus on security cleared projects. Although this is a new design consultancy, they have the backing of larger companies meaning you still have the job security of working for a large company. You will also have benefits including pension, share purchase schemes, healthcare, life assurance  and other excellent benefits not normally available to smaller organisations. We are looking for an Electronics Engineer who has ideally worked on MOD, Security Clearance or other sensitive technologies. Due to the nature of consultancy services, your electronics experience could be across a number of fields such as RF Engineering,  Microwave Electronics, Analogue Electronics, Sensors Technologies, PCB Electronics or other complex electronics design. It will also be ideal if you have specific Firmware, Embedded or other software experience. Due to the nature of work, you must already hold or be able to obtain security clearance. Apart from the benefits, you will be rewarded with an excellent salary, career opportunities and a continued skills training to keep you at the forefront of technologies. This is a rare opportunity to be involved with a design consultancy at the ground level, meaning future career development will be more likely than with other consultancies or companies. Due to this, I'm expecting a lot of interest in this role. If you are  interested in the role, apply now or risk missing out. For more information, please feel free to call Andrew Welsh, Director of Medical Devices recruitment and Scientific recruitment specialists Newton Colmore Consulting, on + or make an application and one of our team at Newton Colmore Consulting will contact  you. Newton Colmore Consulting is a specialist recruitment company within the Medical Devices, Scientific Engineering, Scientific Software, Robotics, Data Science, Healthcare Communications. Science, Electronics Design, New Product Design, Human Factors, Regulatory  Affairs, Quality Assurance and Field Service Engineering sectors.

Exciting Marketing Executive Opportunity - Join a Forward-Thinking Team! We are currently recruiting for an ambitious and creative Marketing Executive on behalf of our client, a forward-thinking company that thrives on integrating cutting-edge technologies into their commercial processes. This is a fantastic opportunity for a motivated individual who is passionate about blending traditional creative skills with the latest in data-driven marketing tools. As a Marketing Executive, you'll collaborate closely with both the marketing and senior  management teams, delivering visually appealing and engaging content while contributing to impactful marketing strategies. Key Responsibilities for the Marketing Executive: Creating high-quality videos, graphics, and other visual assets to boost brand visibility.Crafting engaging copy for websites, landing pages, social media, and email campaigns.Ensuring websites are optimized for SEO, performance, and user engagement.Managing social media platforms, including scheduling posts, monitoring interactions, and driving engagement.Tracking and analyzing campaign performance to make data-driven improvements.Assisting the Digital Marketing Manager with campaign creation and execution.Working closely with various departments to meet their marketing and communication needs.Key skills for the Marketing Executive: Has an achievement-focused personality with a "can-do" attitude.Is naturally inquisitive, energetic, and passionate about storytelling and idea generation.Has excellent organizational and time management skills, able to meet tight deadlines.Pays attention to even the smallest details.Is a true team player with strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.Possesses some experience with graphic design and video editing.Ideally, has experience with WordPress and basic knowledge or interest in AI tools.This role is perfect for someone eager to join the world of marketing. You'll not only contribute to the company's success but also continue to grow and enhance your own skills.

Interim P2P Accounts Payable Manager (French language skills) - Bracknell based (hybrid) - 6-month contract - £250 - £275pd (inside IR35) Are you an experienced AP Manager within a corporate P2P environment? Are you fluent in French? Have you driven process standardisation improvement across P2P workstreams? This opportunity for an interim P2P Accounts Payable Manager within a global brand plays well for these skills. job_desc: A skilled Azure Data Engineer with at least 3 years of relevant experience is needed to join our team at Now-Casting, a leading economic forecasting company based in London on a full-time, remote (work-from-home) basis. Candidates living in or near London  will be given preference.  You will take a key role in the ongoing modernisation and management of our data processing and reporting platform. The platform, which primarily runs on Microsoft Azure, is in the process of migrating and consolidating into Azure Databricks.  This is an excellent opportunity to work with the latest and greatest Cloud and Data Engineering technologies and play a central role in a 'Big Data' business, which is increasingly involved in developing and supporting AI/ML models. About Us Now-Casting is a specialist econometric research and forecasting business, set up by world leading academics.  The business is data-intensive, harnessing the latest econometric techniques - including machine learning models - to deliver a high value service  to professional investors.   Established more than 10 years ago, the business has a strong reputation in an international market. Although the company is based in London, its clients are in North America, Europe, Scandinavia and the Middle East. Key Responsibilities: Managing the company's data assets, processes and infrastructure to ensure data integrity and optimal performanceDesigning and implementing data pipelines and workflows for data processing and reportingCollaborating with cross-functional teams to gather and analyse requirementsIntegrating the platform with third-party APIsRequired Experience: Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience working as a Cloud and/or Data Engineer with a focus on Databricks, Azure (e.g. Azure Data Lake Storage), Apache Spark (PySpark), Python, and SQLDesirable Skills: TDD  (e.g. PyTest)CI/CD  (e.g. Azure DevOps or GitLab)MLFlowUnity CatalogMLOpsDockerSounds interesting? Click the APPLY button to send your CV for immediate consideration. Candidates with previous experience or job titles including; Cloud Data Engineering Specialist, Azure Data Platform Engineer, Cloud Data Architect, Azure Data Solutions Engineer, Azure Data Integration Engineer, Cloud Data Pipeline Engineer, Azure Data Warehouse  Engineer, Cloud Data Infrastructure Specialist, and Azure Data Analytics Engineer will also be considered.

Established for over 35 years, the company operates from 12 offices around the world, and with over 140  employees.Their growing International Market Expansion practice is now looking to add a French-speaking Business Development Associate to their team to be based in London, with potential to move to France after 1-2 years.An ideal candidate will have a STEM or Business/Management degree and also have a deep interest and experience of Asia (Japan, South Korea, China, ASEAN, India). job_desc: Compliance Executive Salary: £38,840  Location: London, hybrid working  Hours: Open to flexible working, 21 hours minimum  Benefits: Flexible benefits  Job Type: Permanent  We have the following opportunity:  1 x Compliance Executive, open to flexible working (21 hours minimum) Start date: Jan 25 The Compliance team sits at the forefront of the ASA’s proactive regulation, working to address non-compliance across all sectors and media, including online.  We work in a fast-moving environment where the media we regulate is constantly evolving and the regulatory and political landscape is shifting. To help us meet the challenge of regulating ads within that context, we have a new role available.  This is an exciting time for the team as it evolves. Increasingly, we are using machine learning-based monitoring technologies and automation to tackle noncompliance at pace and scale, supported by our growing Data Science team.  To be successful in this role, you will be a highly motivated individual, comfortable working in a diverse and challenging role involving compliance and enforcement work. You will demonstrate your ability to learn quickly, work autonomously and find creative  solutions to challenges. You must have an ability to collaborate effectively and develop strong relationships with colleagues, stakeholders and those we regulate alike. Strong written and oral communication skills are essential.  We think the ASA is a great place to work, with a fantastic office in Shoreditch, London. We have a culture that’s open, friendly and collaborative, with a real focus on making the right decisions in the right way, and learning while we’re doing it. We welcome  applications from all sections of society and we’re committed to being a diverse and inclusive organisation, both so we can represent everyone in the UK and so our own colleagues feel at home at work.  How to apply: If you are interested in applying for these roles please review the job description below and complete the online questions outlining how you meet the requirements of the role and how you can contribute to the success of the  Compliance Team. Please ensure that you provide all the information required on the online form as we do not accept CV's or attachments and cannot edit applications.  We operate a hybrid working model and office attendance is required 40% of your contracted hours.  Please do not enter your name in any of the fields unless asked to do so. This is to help our managers to shortlist applications without knowing your name, gender, ethnicity or nationality. Thank you for your co-operation.

job_title: Product Manager - Supply Chain and Physical Assets
job_desc: The company data and analytics team designs and builds company data analytical tools for the Bloomberg Terminal, API and Enterprise. This includes flagship applications on Bloomberg such as: Financial Analysis (FA), Estimates and Models (MODL) and Supply  Chain (SPLC). In today's environment dominated by macroeconomic and geopolitical events, understanding a company's supply chain and physical assets (e.g, factories, mines and refineries) is critical. This role focuses on developing analytical tools to help investors and  corporations better understand these exposures. Please note, this position is not focused on managing Bloomberg LP's supply chain but on building tools that allow investors to analyse the supply chain of other companies. The ideal candidate will be a strong collaborator, working closely with our engineering groups, data teams and enterprise product teams. You should be comfortable articulating an overall business strategy while confidently engaging with bottom-up technical  details. We will trust you to:Engage directly with clients, identify key questions and develop targeted solutions Develop a product roadmap and oversee incremental deliveries of your strategic vision, ensuring clear business outcomes Effectively manage projects, meet deliverables, and lead the execution of tasks both independently and collaboratively Ensure we have the relevant data - with the correct standardisation/aggregation needed to build terminal solutions Effectively communicate product vision and build consensus with senior stakeholdersYou'll need to have:Understanding of Supply Chains and Physical Assets from an investor's perspective Experience working with knowledge graphs and relational databases Experience developing business strategies, including defining OKRs, analysis of value propositions, and considering channels of delivery Evidence of technical fluency - being comfortable discussing technical concepts and experience evaluating trade-offs in design with engineering 7+ years of relevant experienceWe'd love to see:Extensive Product Manager experience bringing complex products to market Experience applying AI techniques for data processing and answering client questions Experience using a scrum agile process A degree/Masters/PhD in STEM subject or Economics/Finance Experience working with Software as a Service (SAAS) CFA designation Project management certification (CAPM, PMP)

job_title: Global Reporting & Insights Manager, Customer Strategy
job_desc: Global Reporting & Insights Manager, Customer StrategyLocation: Central London Working set up: Hybrid, 2 days in office a week Salary: £50,000 to £60,000 (experience dependent)  You’ll be joining the Global Customer Strategy function of a luxury retail brand and be responsible for taking control of their reporting capability linked to both their global CRM initiatives and CIX programmes. It’s a programme of work designed  to provide actionable intelligence to regional teams on what’s going on at a consumer level around key performance metrics and indicators across their business and all channels.  Whether it’s around the performance of certain marketing activities. Or looking at the health of the consumer CRM database, and how marketing initiatives are impacting on opt in and out rates at both country, region and global levels. Or even identifying  best practices happening at a country level, sharing those into other regions as to help raise the game of the company as a whole. Your role will have a big, strategic impact on initiatives through the provision of actionable insights and commercial recommendations  off the back of what the data is telling you.  You will have the support of a Global Agency partner who will be pulling the data for you, providing a lot of the reports for you to dig into. The work you’ll be carrying out sits at this more strategic level, identifying the key narrative and insights from  the data. Extrapolating the key take aways and translating them into something meaningful for the relevant audience you’ll be delivering them to.  Internal stakeholders can be channel performance teams, CRM functions, sales teams, customer experience or even up to and including the Global CEO and respective Board members. Your work will have an impact across the whole organisation.  Which means the ability to translate and adapt message for the target audience is critical. So they’re able to understand not just the ‘what is’ from the report itself. But also the ‘so what’, ‘why’ and set of recommendations you’re making based off the  data, along with projected outcomes and commercial results which can be expected.  Alongside this, you will be responsible for defining best practice when it comes to global consistency of customer data initiatives and reporting capabilities. Ensuring data is captured, trackable and usable, so can be translated into effective measurement  and reporting capabilities.  You will be surrounded by an insights and data science community within the business, pulling from them with any more advanced analytics resource support requirements.  ABOUT THE TEAM The team you will be joining is the company’s global customer experience and CRM function. It’s a team of around 7-8 people, who are responsible for devising global strategy and best practice across both these discipline areas, and for all channels. So whilst  the team is relatively small, the impact of their work is far-reaching and holds considerable influence on the company’s bottom line results each year.  The role you’ll be taking on is new to the organisation, come about through growth in the sophistication of what they’re doing in customer experience measurement, and investment in data science capabilities as well as a new CDP implementation.  As such, you will have a journey of development ahead of you as you explore the growth of your remit and the impact it can have across the organisation. They’re a massive brand and a very complex organisation, so you’re going to find it takes time to establish  yourself, work out who all your stakeholders are and how you can become best placed to deliver to the needs of everyone across such an expansive operation.  EXPERIENCE NEEDED Highly effective at drawing meaningful insights and turning them into actionable recommendations, which you’ve also been responsible for championing within the business Have experience working in a large-scale, complex data environment, analysing B2C consumer data Good understanding of how to define ‘great’ in a reporting capability for a business Commercially sound thinking – i.e. you have a good appreciation and understanding of the mechanics within a business, and if you’re recommending certain changes be made, what impacts they could have and why. Confident presentation skills and good with translating complex data related findings, distilling them into business speak commercial and marketing stakeholders understand Technical proficiency with Excel, good knowledge of a visualisation tool like Tableau Gregarious and outgoing nature. Highly collaborative with great communication skills Want to Apply? Here’s how: You can share your Linkedin profile or email me a CV – it doesn’t have to be up to date, we can work on that once you decide you want to take this forward.  Or, for a chat and more information please contact me on:  Colin DoreeHead of Recruitment, Marketing, Digital & DataBlue Pelican

What We Offer AI-Enhanced Training Programme: Comprehensive training using advanced technology to accelerate your professional growth.Fast-Track Career Progression: Average promotion to management within 1.6 years.Uncapped Commission & High Earnings Potential: Competitive salary with no limit on the amount you can earn through commission.Relocation Support: We assist you in making your move to Prague smooth and stress-free, with guidance on local living and settling in.Office-Based Environment: Gain valuable face-to-face interactions and real-time learning opportunities, crucial for rapid development through immediate feedback and hands-on experience.New Rules for UK Nationals: UK nationals can now more easily work in Czechia, thanks to simplified visa and work permit processes. Our team will provide full guidance to ensure you have a smooth transition to working in Prague.What You'll Do As a Trainee Recruitment Consultant for our UK Social Care Division, you will be responsible for: Cold Calling & Business Development: Contacting clients and candidates in the UK social care sector. This involves substantial phone work to generate new business and manage vacancies.Market Focus: Building and managing a network of candidates and clients in the UK social care industry, handling multiple roles and opportunities.Managing the Full Recruitment Process: Oversee the entire recruitment process-from sourcing candidates to securing placements. You will also handle client communication to ensure smooth hiring processes.Market Building: Develop and expand your market by building strong candidate and client bases, fostering relationships, and driving revenue.Who We're Looking For We are looking for sharp, driven individuals who are passionate about sales and recruitment. While academic degrees are not a primary requirement, we value practical skills and sharp thinking. For this role, fluency in English is essential due to the focus on the UK market. Key qualities include: Energetic & Personable: Ability to build strong rapport with candidates and clients.Empathy: Understand and relate to the needs and emotions of others.Motivation & Drive: Set high personal goals and work diligently to achieve them.Resilience: Thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.Strong Communication Skills: Confidently engage with clients and candidates over the phone.Practical Judgment: Demonstrate sound decision-making skills and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.Technological Capability: Comfortable using AI tools and databases in recruitment processes.Adaptability & Learning: Open to feedback and continuous improvement.Commitment to an Office-Based Role: Dedication to working in an office environment to maximize learning and development through direct interaction with mentors and colleagues.Why Prague? Prague is one of Europe's most beautiful and liveable cities, offering a rich cultural scene, affordable living costs, and a high quality of life. With recent changes to work regulations, it's also become easier for UK nationals to secure employment in Czechia, with simplified visa and work permit processes. NonStop Consulting will guide you through every step of the relocation and onboarding process. Ready to Start Your Career? If you're driven to excel in the UK social care market and passionate about making a real impact, we want to hear from you! This role offers the chance to make a difference in people's lives while achieving your own career success. Apply now to start your  journey with us in Prague, Czechia. Our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch within seven days to guide you through the next steps. Join NonStop Consulting and succeed in the UK Social Care Division in Prague!

Company: Cuffe and Taylor, part of Live Nation (Music) UK Ltd Department: Cuffe and Taylor Operations Location: Preston OR Farringdon, London and onsite at shows/festivals when appropriate Reports to: Director of Operations Working Hours: Full-time plus additional evenings and weekends to accommodate shows and festivals Job Type: Permanent Role Description We’re looking for an experienced Customer Service Manager who will be the driving force behind delivering the highest level in customer service to all customers and fans across the Cuffe and Taylor portfolio. The role will include being responsible for the  management and improvement of customer service at Cuffe and Taylor which will involve customer information, customer queries managed via ZenDesk. Cuffe & Taylor is one of the UK’s top live music, theatre and event promoters. Established for more than 10 years and part of the Live Nation family, they present breath-taking tours, festivals and shows across the UK filling football stadiums, arenas, theatres  and major historical sites. Cuffe & Taylor’s roster of artists is extensive and varied including Diana Ross, Lionel Richie, Britney Spears, Rod Stewart, Christina Aguilera, Mariah Carey, Lewis Capaldi, Sir Tom Jones, Bryan Adams, Kylie, Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds, Stereophonics,  George Ezra, The Strokes, Sam Fender and Def Leppard. They also operate a hugely successful theatre touring department across the UK and internationally programming thousands of nights of entertainment ranging from live podcasts, screen-to-stage TV adaptations  and musical theatre. In 2023 they were recipients of an Olivier Award, for Best Family Show, for their original production of 'Hey Duggee - The Live Theatre Show’. Who you are Competencies / Skills / Knowledge / Experience Experience in delivering excellent customer serviceAdvanced knowledge and understanding of ZenDeskExperience in working in a busy, high-volume working environmentSenior operational experience within either the live entertainment, visitor attraction or hospitality industriesManagement experienceStrong leadership skillsStrong organisational skills and attention-to-detailExcellent communication skillsAdvanced knowledge and experience with Microsoft Excel and Outlook.Excellent English language and grammarImprovement of the customer service systems and interest to explore new technologies such as AIBehaviours The following attributes determine how the role will be carried out and are required to be a success Customer focused with a desire for high levels of serviceAbility to foster problem solving between teams and stakeholders, and to arrive at a solution that will contribute to the overall achievement of business goalsHighly motivated and dedicated - ability to work deadlines and achieve targets in a time conscious mannerWhat the role includes Management of the customer service departmentTactical, operational and hands on customer experience leadershipManagement of the ZenDesk softwareAnswering customer queriesEnsuring the software is utilised to its full ability including AI, auto responses, triggers and macrosEnsuring the FAQ and Event Information Pages are up to date via ZenDesk Help Centre pages.Constant review of the customer experience and identifying actions to improve.Supporting the departments of Cuffe and Taylor in delivering a high level of customer service including operations, marketing and ticketing.Identifying key trends in customer service.Assisting with the volunteer management.Work on site at events and festivals as required, including weekends and evenings.Creating reports for the Senior Management Team and Directors to include key statistics such as the number of customer emails / social media messages and response times.Equal Opportunities We are passionate and committed to our people and go beyond the rhetoric of diversity and inclusion. You will be working in an inclusive environment and be encouraged to bring your whole self to work. We will do all that we can to help you successfully balance  your work and homelife. As a growing business we will encourage you to develop your professional and personal aspirations, enjoy new experiences, and learn from the talented people you will be working with. It’s talent that matters to us and we encourage applications  from people irrespective of their gender identity, race, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status or caring responsibilities. The Company Cuffe and Taylor is part of Live Nation Entertainment which is the world’s leading live entertainment company comprised of global market leaders: Ticketmaster, Live Nation Concerts, LN Media and Artist Nation Management. APPLICATION DEADLINE: 30th October 2024. We reserve the right close applications at any time.

The AI Theory group at the London Research Center is seeking a Research Scientist to contribute to the development of the theoretical and algorithmic foundation for AIGC. The team is tackling ambitious projects focusing on AIGC theory and Multimodal text-and-image/video  generation. The ideal candidate should have experience in LLM and Multimodal-LLM, Generative Modelling (Diffusion Models, Auto-regressive Models, Transformers), and/or Efficient Learning (Data Efficiency, Optimization Theory) The research scientist will conduct  both academic and applied research. They will aim to advance the state-of-the-art in multimodal modelling with top tier conference publications and will collaboratively develop advanced products and services with other groups in the company. Key Responsibilities: Leading and participating in cutting-edge research projects, focusing on the theoretical and algorithmic foundation of AIGC. Devising, prototyping and patenting innovative solutions in collaboration with product teams. External engagement: drafting academic publications, giving talks and collaborating with academic leaders. Mentoring research interns and junior researchers. This job description is only an outline of the tasks, responsibilities and outcomes required of the role. The jobholder will carry out any other duties as may be reasonably required by his/her line manager. The job description and personal specification  may be reviewed on an ongoing basis in accordance with the changing needs of Huawei Research and Development UK Limited. Person Specification: Required: PhD degree computer science or related field; or equivalent research experience. Hands on experience with image/video generation and/or (multimodal) large language models. Strong research track record. E.g. have published in top tier conferences including NeurIPS, ICLR, ICML, CVPR, ICCV; and journals including JMLR and TPAMI, etc. Strong coding skills: ability to quickly prototype in Python. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Desired: Passionate about (multimodal) large language models, text-to-image/video model, controllable generation. Experience mentoring other junior researchers. Experience working in industry and collaborating with product groups. Experience with PyTorch Profiler, Accelerate/DeepSpeed/Megatron/ HuggingFace PEFT. Hands on experience with ViTs, (Multimodal)-LLMs, Diffusions, (Video) VAEs, etc

job_title: Data Strategy Manager - CRM & CDP migration
job_desc: Data Strategy Manager – CRM & CDP migrationLocation: London's West End, typically 2 days a weekSalary: Up to £75,000 (DoE) Term: 12 month FTC  What’s special about this opportunity isn’t just the brand you’ll be joining, but also just how ground breaking and impactful the project is you’ll be getting your teeth into.  Your work will be covering the EMEA region for a global fashion retailer. Joining a team made up of data and CRM specialists covering multiple areas, including:  CRM marketers - responsible for delivery of customer communications across channel, customer experience and journeys, as well as the segmentation strategy for each market. Data and insight teams – dealing with customer insight, reporting and trading based insights as well as planning Data strategy – the team you’ll be a part of. Which includes a couple of analysts data scientists and data strategists. CRM is responsible for around 30% of this company’s global revenue. So it’s hugely important as a part of the marketing mix, and data is a key resource for competitor advantage.  That’s why they’ve been investing so much, growing their in-house data teams and pulling some of the biggest names in the industry to become a part of their journey. Breaking new ground for a retailer in their space, delivering a series of significant ‘firsts’  in recent years.  They’re at a phase now of pushing forward with a CDP migration, and that’s why your role is so critical. Helping to support on the technical side of CRM data requirements gathering as well as data strategy for the EMEA region, really helping to orchestrate  things and successfully land this programme.  Your remit will include:  Helping to project manage the data design and data strategy side of the CDP integration, creation of a data dictionary and data feeds Able to go into the technical layer and validate data, ensuring correct flows across the various customer journeys. So will need a clear understanding of data architecture and CRM data flows – from capture, optimisation and enhancement to utilisation Helping to steer data strategy within the EMEA region and sharing best practice amongst regional and global teams – covering everything from raw data capture on a micro-site, how to leverage and make best use of data in segmentations, trigger identification,  etc. To how it can be used with various Martech platforms for enhancement of personalisation Champion it’s rollout across the EMEA region, including UAT and ensuring it meets business requirements and objectives Ensuring the team are on top of data requirements arising from across the business, prioritising business requirements and managing relationships with stakeholders accordingly to manage their expectations on delivery Working with data science and decision science teams on utilisation of data for enhancing personalisation and AI model suite Experience Necessary Sound understanding of data strategy within a CRM environment, and good understanding of data governance principles You ideally have either worked on the data strategy behind the implementation of a CDP before. Or helped with a data migration of such. You really understand how data works for a business. How it can be captured, moves through a business and can be used to deliver enhancements to customer engagement, personalisation, identification of marketing opportunities, etc. Some technical knowledge around SQL, Python, etc. Comfortable navigating large, complex businesses with matrix based teams Solid communication skills, able to articulate ideas and strategies to senior business leaders and establish buy-in Want to Apply? Here’s how: You can share your Linkedin profile or email me a CV – it doesn’t have to be up to date, we can work on that once you decide you want to take this forward.  Or, for a chat and more information please contact me on:  Colin DoreeHead of Recruitment, Marketing, Digital & DataBlue Pelican

Role overview Helping to define, organise and share the best of what Ipsos knows - empowering our people and our clients to make better decisions. The Ipsos Knowledge Centre is charged with transforming how our colleagues and clients access Ipsos’ expertise - and it is entering an exciting new phase in its development, as Generative AI tools reshape our approach to Knowledge ManagementThe foundation stones of this work are our partnership with the Global Learning team, our programme of thought leadership, and the tools and channels we are developing to deliver this content to its audiencesWe are looking for a talented and energetic individual to help us expand our initiatives, and provide new impetusYou will be joining a small team, based in London, Paris, Sydney, Canada, and India. But our focus is global, working with our teams and clients all around the worldWe need you to help us make our ideas and ambitions a concrete reality, and to bring some of your own. Your administrative and organisational skills will be critical in knitting the team’s work together, and you will have an important part to play in making  our new initiatives sustainable. Ipsos UK offers a hybrid working environment, 3 days in the office and working the rest from home. What will I be doing? We have three connected purposes - and you will have a key role in each: Defining the Knowledge: The "Ipsos Encyclopedia" Manage the transformation of our Ipsos Encyclopedia as it converges with the Ipsos Training CentreOwn the process for creating, updating, and reviewing content in this joint resourceDeploy creative and design skills to make the content as usable and appealing as possibleMaintain our ISO9001 certification by ensuring our processes are not just followed, but improved where necessaryLead on projects to develop new tranches of contentSupporting the Knowledge Centre’s broader content programme and ensuring the Encyclopedia’s programme is joined up with itOrganising the Knowledge: making it discoverable Create new ways to package and distribute content, tailored to the specific needs of the intended audience, and using different formats (including video and audio)Ensure that the metadata is properly managed and conforms to best practiceSupport and supervise our team in India as they continuously refresh our stock of knowledgeMonitor and report on metrics and KPIsDeliver good user experience, and carry out research to discover how it might be improvedSharing the Knowledge: helping colleagues and clients to engage Moderate and manage conversations in our internal social collaboration spacesFind imaginative ways to activate and animate our internal teams and communitiesExplore applications ofIpsos Facto, our in-house Generative AI tool, to improve our processes and sharpen our contentSelect from our existing suite of tools to promote and market our content internally and externallyRun a helpdesk to support the users of our various services.What do I need to bring with me? Experience in Knowledge ManagementStrong administrative and organisational qualities, and a real attention to detailAdaptable and flexible: comfortable working in a small team within a diverse and diffuse organisationProficient in using Microsoft Office tools, particularly PowerPointFamiliarity with SharePoint, ideally SharePoint Online, would be advantageous but not essentialFluent in English, both spoken and writtenA basic working knowledge of statistics would be helpfulAn interest and willingness to pick up new tools quickly, particularly Generative AIWhat is in it for me? Ipsos UK offer an attractive basic salary and a rewards package including 25 days annual leave, a pension scheme and a great range of flexible benefits to suit your personal needs.For roles at Research Manager level and above we also offer private healthcare. In addition to this we have a fantastic Learning & Development offer delivered through a mix of face to face, online or on-demand. We realise you may have commitments outside of work and will consider flexible working applications - please highlight what you are looking for when you make your application. Ipsos is committed to equality, treating people fairly, promoting a positive and inclusive working environment and ensuring we have diversity of people and views. Wealso recognise that this is important for our business success - a more diverse workforce  will enable us to better reflect and understand the world we research and ultimately deliver better research and insight to our clients. About Us Ipsos is one of the world’s largest research companies and currently the only one primarily managed by researchers, ranking as a #1full-service research organization for four consecutive years. With over 75 different data-driven solutions, and presence in  90 markets, Ipsos brings together research, implementation, methodological, and subject-matter experts from around the world, combining thematic and technical experts to deliver top-quality research and insights. Simply speaking, we help the biggest companies  solve some of their biggest problems, serving more than 5000 clients across the globe by providing research, data, and insights on their target markets. And we’re proud to share we’ve received our Great Place to Work Certificationin 2022 & 2023!

At Bloomberg, our products are fueled by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock - from around the world. In Data, we're responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through  innovative technology - quickly and accurately. We move markets by providing our clients with sought-after financials that are normalized across industries and companies, key  analytical ratios, and industry-specific data points. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and we implement technology solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes. Our team of sector-aligned analysts influence  investment decisions and move the markets every day, and we are growing. The Earnings Extraction team is responsible for extracting key performance indicators from company earnings documents to provide clients data within milliseconds through Bloomberg News and other distribution channels. These rules focus on the most relevant,  market-moving data points, publishing this data to headline news stories, terminal functions, and enterprise data feeds. What's the Role? We are looking for a highly motivated and driven individual to lead the Earnings Extraction team. The team is located in London and covers the global markets. job_title: Junior Recruiter - Sales Career with Uncapped Commission
job_desc: Junior Recruitment Consultant | Achieve High Earnings Fast  Want a career where your earnings match your ambition? Join us as a Junior Recruitment Consultant and enjoy high earning potential from day one, with generous commissions on top of a competitive base salary. Location: Canary Wharf, London, UK Who We Are: Founded in 2000, NonStop Consulting is a leader in recruitment services across Europe and the USA. We provide ambitious individuals with the opportunity to develop their careers in a dynamic and supportive environment. Our AI-enhanced training programme  is designed to fast-track your success, ensuring you have the skills and tools needed to excel in recruitment. What We Offer: AI-Enhanced Training Programme: You'll receive comprehensive training, using advanced technology to accelerate your professional growth.Fast-Track Career Progression: We promote from within, and on average, our consultants move to management within 1.6 years.Uncapped Commission & High Earnings Potential: With a competitive salary and uncapped commission, top performers can earn 100k+GBP within two years.International Work Environment: You'll be working with colleagues from all over the world and gain experience working with clients and candidates within Europe or the US - according to your market specialisation.Office-Based Environment: The office setting offers valuable face-to-face interactions and real-time learning opportunities that accelerate your growth and performance. This environment allows you to benefit from immediate feedback and  hands-on experience, which is crucial for rapid development in your role.What You'll Do: As a Trainee Recruitment Consultant, you'll specialize in building and developing a network of employers (clients) and job seekers (candidates) within one specific market, typically focusing on a particular country. Your main responsibilities include: Cold Calling & Business Development: Proactively reach out to potential clients, identifying new business opportunities and building relationships. You'll spend a significant amount of time on the phone each day, working to win new business  and generate job orders.Market Focus: You will primarily focus on building a network of candidates and clients within one specific country and one specific industry, becoming an expert in that market. Occasionally, you'll have the opportunity to work on roles  in different countries, broadening your international experience.Managing the Full Recruitment Process: As you develop your skills and demonstrate your abilities, you'll be trained to manage the entire recruitment process-from sourcing candidates and guiding them through the interview process to seeing  them start in their new jobs. You'll also learn to handle client communication, manage expectations, and ensure a smooth hiring process. Once you've shown you can handle these tasks, you'll take full ownership of your market and recruitment processes.Market Building: You'll be responsible for growing your own market by building a strong candidate and client base, continually developing relationships and driving revenue.Who We're Looking For: We are looking for intelligent, motivated individuals who are eager to build a successful career in recruitment. Academic degrees are not a primary consideration; instead, we value sharp thinking and practical skills. You should be comfortable in a phone-based  sales role, as cold calling and business development will be a major part of your daily work. Key qualities include: Motivation & Drive: You set high goals for yourself and work hard to achieve them.Resilience: Recruitment is challenging, but you thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.Strong Communication Skills: You must be able to confidently engage with clients and candidates over the phone.Practical Judgment: You demonstrate sound decision-making skills and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.Technological Capability: You are comfortable using AI tools and databases, as we leverage advanced technology in our recruitment processes.Adaptability & Learning: You're open to feedback and continuously look for ways to improve and grow.Commitment to an Office-Based Role: This position is office-based to maximize learning and development through direct interaction with mentors and colleagues. We believe that the collaborative environment and immediate feedback will significantly  enhance your growth and success.Ready to Start Your Career?

Bloomberg runs on data, and in Data we're responsible for acquiring and providing it to our clients. We collect, model, analyze, and publish data which is the backbone of the Bloomberg Terminal. We apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow  efficiencies and we implement solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes- all while delivering advanced insights to our clients. We're responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. As a member of our News Indexing team, you will be responsible for automated classification of the world's most meaningful financial and economic news with the aim of furthering Bloomberg as a leader in the financial news market. We use proprietary and open-source  software to automatically retrieve, parse, coordinate, and tag news from social media sites, news feeds, web sites, and other sources that run on the Bloomberg Professional Service. We also build and maintain our sophisticated taxonomy of classification tags  according to clients' needs. A Bachelor's degree in; Finance, Business, Economics, STEM, or related degree/equivalent experience 4+ years' of relevant work experience*Excellent problem solving skills and ability to pay close attention to detailStrong written and verbal communication skillsProven understanding of customer service and experience in building internal strong relationships with partners2+ years of project management experience in information management*Interest/knowledge in financial and economic data and newsUse sound judgment to escalate issues as they arise Ability to adapt to priorities and product needs Ability to work in the US without visa sponsorship now or in the futureWe'd love to see:A Bachelor's degree in subject areas such as Library Science, Linguistics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or other computer-related specializationA related Masters Degree Knowledge of U.S. market trends, themes, and driversExperience working on data science projects and technologies, especially using NLP techniques to take care of unstructured text corpusExperience in editing, writing, curating, labeling or assigning news storiesDemonstrated capability in data management, data processing, data analysis, and/or associated tools and technologies. Understanding of a programming or query language and experience of using it for a data analysis (e.g. R, Python, JavaScript, SQL, etc.)Experience in using categorization, filtering or mining software (such as OpenCalais, Datasift, GNIP, Inxight, IDOL, Verity, Clear Forest, Microsoft Fast)Does this sound like you?Apply if you think we're a good match. job_title: Director of Data & Insight - Luxury Travel
job_desc: Director of Data & Insight – Luxury TravelLocation: UK, Remote (Must be based in the UK) Salary: £100,000 to £120,000 plus 25% bonus and benefits  Although this is a Director role, reporting to C-Suite and the Board. The company is only around 200 people, and their data infrastructure is still in a growth and development phase. W hat this translates to is a role which will need you to be comfortable  getting your hands dirty rather than having a big team to delegate things to for delivery. As currently the data function is just two reports. Both very sharp and capable, one being an analyst, the other a data engineer.  But this is a growth mandate, and the reason they’re looking for a Director appointment is for a need to bring in someone with a sharper commercial and business focused mindset. Rather than biasing towards a technical skillset who is competent and capable  when it comes to the model creation and technical build side of things.  Keys to success You’ll be taking over the reigns to all things data for a well-recognised luxury travel brand. This business will be undergoing positive changes following acquisition by a global hospitality business. Those changes will include looking at exploiting the  partnership opportunities the two businesses combined can offer to consumers, as well as what could be achieved with their combined data assets too.  In addition will be growth of your unit and team. As functionally you will be overseeing all aspects of data including:  Data strategy and governance – aligning these with the company’s overall vision and strategy. Defining a data dictionary, ensuring a robust governance framework is in place for data quality and processes Application of advanced analytics and insights within the business – be it through pricing strategies and application of AI solutions for this, coupled with advanced modelling capabilities in understanding customer behaviour, retention modelling,  customer segmentation and cannibalisation prevention. Maintenance and continued evolution of the company’s reporting capability. Currently based on Looker, and with a wider business that’s relatively self-sufficient at pulling what they need. Your team drops in to support on complex new report builds when needed. But there’s going to be opportunity to also overall and review what’s in place regularly  to ensure it’s fit for purpose and delivering to business needs Define the future business needs around the field of data science and AI, and their commercial application within the business. Current capabilities have been more traditional advanced analytics capabilities (CRM analytics, retention, propensity  modelling). With this, they’re looking for you to identify opportunities to bring in new capabilities and successfully land them into commercially meaningful and impactful solutions for the business. E.g. AI LLM chatbots for customer service solutions or website  automation. Or AI application for pricing recommendation engines to drive pricing optimisation strategies. Oversee the continued development of the company’s data engineering pipeline and capabilities. It’s all currently sitting on a Redshift platform with ETL through Airflow. Data is all in the one location and the data feeds are reliable. Trading data  only has a minor delay, so work can be carried out with near-real time data. But this will continue to grow and evolve with the business, and you will ultimately be responsible for taking ownership of all data pipelines. Ensuring they’re representative of  robust, scalable solutions. As you can see, there’s a lot of moving parts to this role. But keep in mind contextually they represent a medium sized organisation who caters for a luxury niche within the travel industry.  Whilst your role will be broad and be responsible all their respective data estate. A lot of what’s in front of you will be a mandate to build and evolve their capability from the current, relatively small state. Into one which will become a much more large-scale,  robust capability as the business continues to grow and develop, and you see your role respectively grow alongside it.  Some of this will be achieved through the existing team. Some of this will require additional support and the establishment of new business cases for investment from the Board. You will be responsible for defining and selling these in. With expectation for  growth to come in 2025 and beyond to help you achieve the company’s ambitions.  If you’ve got the kind of drive and determination to take on an opportunity like this with such a great deal of potential ahead of it. Why not apply today to find out more?  Experience needed Solid leadership credentials within the data and analytics industry. Having had experience working across data and insight, data engineering, data science, data strategy. Your experience leans more towards commercially minded rather than technically biased these days. But you’ve come from that world, so can coach, mentor, train and develop analysts, data engineers, data scientists, etc. But these days you’re more comfortable  and adept at selling in the business concepts and value data creates, rather than just doing the coding. You love to build high performing data teams who in turn create value for companies Good knowledge of the various technologies and data ecosystems out there for data science, engineering, reporting, AI solutions, etc. and their application Have worked with consumer data and had a good level of experience working in a marketing/customer analytics type of environment before Able to demonstrate commercial impact of your work and the value it’s driven for businesses Want to Apply? Here’s how: You can share your Linkedin profile or email me a CV – it doesn’t have to be up to date, we can work on that once you decide you want to take this forward.  Or, for a chat and more information please contact me on:  Colin DoreeHead of Recruitment, Marketing, Digital & DataBlue Pelican

Knowledge: Proven experience as a machine learning engineer, data scientist, or a similar role. * A comprehensive grasp of machine learning methodologies and principles, encompassing supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning. Experience  deploying computer vision models is particularly desirable. * Experience with data manipulation, preprocessing, and feature engineering techniques. * Experience building Machine Learning solutions for scalable, reliable deployments * Experience developing  testing regimes for machine learning systems, including unit, integration, and performance testing * Experience automating the monitoring and evaluation of machine learning systems including data and model drift * Familiarity with data structures, data modelling,  and software architecture * Experience designing and implementing cloud solutions and ability to build MlOps Pipelines on Azure Cloud. Key skills: vel expertise in the Python programming language including PySpark, * Proficiency in utilising machine learning libraries and frameworks like PyTorch, ONNX, and XGBoost. *Strong understanding of software testing and CI/CD principles and version control (Git,  MLFlow) for automated deployment of machine learning systems * Familiarity with our systems (Azure cloud platform covering Azure DevOps Pipelines, Azure Functions, AzureML, Azure Databricks, CosmosDB) is desirable * Excellent problem-solving skills and analytical  thinking. * Strong communication and collaboration skills.
